In future, Bernardo hopes to build a commercial establishment. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to work more to start his business and increase his income.

loans.use: buy a freezer for his house.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 3 filhos, que frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É operária agrícola e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento, areia, pedra, e outros), para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e mobilar para melhor confortar a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de economizar mais para realizar todos os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Aurelia is married and the mother of 3 children who all go to School, she lives in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.

She's a farmer for a large company and with this loan she plans to buy construction material (blocks, cement, sand, stone and others) to continue the building work on her house.

In future she hopes to finish her house and furnish it to improve her family's level of comfort. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to save more to make her projects a reality.

loans.use: pretende comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento, areia, pedra, e outros), para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.

loans.name: Simel

texts.en:
Simel is an industrious gentleman, age 27, married, and supporting a family of six members. 

He learned about Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) from other farmers in his area who are already registered and being funded by KADET. Simel is a maize farmer and has been in the business for the last seven years, earning an income of KES 15,000.

Simel has acquired his first loan of KES 30,000 which will assist him in the purchase of fertilizer for his growing crops. He hopes to use the increased proceeds to be able to farm a bigger portion of his land.

His dream is to see his family's living standards improved.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge es un agricultor muy emprendedor y con grandes deseos de superación, cultiva maíz y frijoles a los cuales necesita darle mantenimiento con fungicidas, insecticidas y abonos, y es para la compra de estos suministros y semillas de estos granos que está solicitando un crédito de un millón de colones (¢1.000.000), Jorge depende de esta actividad para sostener a su familia, manifiesta que por medio de este financiamiento saldrá adelante económicamente.
texts.en:
Jorge is a very enterprising farmer with a great desire to get ahead.  He grows corn and beans, which he needs to care for with fungicides, insecticides and fertilizers.  

It is for the purchase of these supplies and seeds for these grains that he is applying for a loan of one million colones (¢1.000.000).  Jorge depends on this business to support his family.  He claims that with this financing, he will get ahead economically.

loans.use: to buy supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Philiph

texts.en: Philiph is 28 years old, married, and blessed with two children aged one and two years old. Philiph is a farmer in Kapsabet who raises livestock and grows tea. He has been in business for four years, earning an income of KES 13,000. He has borrowed a third loan, of KES 50,000, from KADET LTD, and intends to use the money to till more land and raise more tea trees. The profits he earns from the sale of his farm produce will be saved for future use. His dream is that his farm will prosper.

loans.use: to till more land and plant tea trees.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 3 filhos, todos maiores, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais 5 netos órfãos que vivem com ela.
É agricultora e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos agrícolas (sementes, adubos, fertilizantes, e culturas de milho, batata, milho e outros), para lançar na sua machamba. 
No futuro deseja fazer crescer a sua machamba produzindo em grandes quantidades e diversidades, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de trabalhar mais e explorar novas áreas de produtos mais necessitados no mercado.
texts.en:
Rosa is married and the mother of 3 children who are all of age. She lives in a house she owns and supports 5 orphan grandchildren who live with her.

She's a farmer and with this loan she plans to buy farming products (seeds, fertilisers and starter crops for corn, potatoes and others) to start off her farm. 

In future, Rosa hopes to grow her farm by producing large quantities of varied products. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to work more and explore new products required on the market.

loans.use: buy farming products (seeds, fertilisers and starter crops for corn, potatoes and others) to start off her farm.

loans.name: Ai's Group

texts.en:
Ai, 50, is married, with four children, residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. One of her children is a dependent and is still in school. 

To support the family, Ai has been farming rice on four hectares of farmland for ten years, while her husband works as a blacksmith in a local area. Together, they can earn about KHR 33,000 per day and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs.

Ai has been with VisionFund Cambodia for three cycles, while the other members have been with VisionFund Cambodia from one to three cycles. Ai completely paid back the loans with VisionFund Cambodia and successfully used the loans to better support her family. 

Now, she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use some of her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland and some of it to spend on labor. Ai hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income, to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en: Imad, who is 42 years old, is a married and the father of six children. He and one of his children earn the family's income. Imad runs a small shop where he makes covers for car seats. He established his business in 2003 after gaining experience by working at a similar shop as an employee for several years. Today he has one employee, and his reputation is growing in his area. He is requesting a loan for $2,100 to pay his shop's annual rent and buy a modern sewing machine. Imad aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to take care of his family’s needs and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to pay rent and buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 5 filhos, dos quais 2 frequentam Escola e os outros 3 já maiores de idade, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais uma neta que vive com ela.
É operária agrícola e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (tijoleira, lavatório, sanita, torneiras, e outros), para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa de banho interna. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa de banho, construir dependências para os seus filhos e um estabelecimento comercial para aumentar a sua renda, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de economizar mais o seu salário para pagar devidamente o empréstimo.
texts.en:
Leonor is married and the mother of 5 children, 2 of whom go to School and 3 who are already of age. She lives in a house she owns and supports a granddaughter who lives with her.

She's a farmer for a large company and with this loan she plans to buy construction material (bricks, sink, toilet, taps and others) to continue building her indoor toilet.

In future she hopes to finish the toilet and build small houses for her children and a commercial establishment to increase her income. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to save more of her salary in order to pay back the loan.

loans.use: buy construction material (bricks, sink, toilet, taps and others) to continue building her indoor toilet.

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en:
Sina is 57 years old and married, with five dependent children. She lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, earning a living through farming rice and planting corn. Together with her husband, they can earn about KHR 62,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs.

This is Sina’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. Sina has been a member of VisionFund Cambodia for two cycles. She successfully used the loans to better her living conditions. 

Now, leading her group to apply for a loan, Sina will use some her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and some of it to spend on labor. Sina hopes to make more rice and to sell it for a good price, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia es una microempresaria de éxitos tiene 47 años de edad, casada y con tres hijos. Su negocio es la venta de tortillas, carne de res en su domicilio, les vende a los lugareños de su comunidad. Tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esa actividad lo que le ha valido sacar adelante a su familia. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de  materia prima como maíz, cal, carne de res, hueso frijoles crudos etc.
texts.en: Ana Julia is a successful micro-entrepreneur who is 47 years old, married, and has three children. She makes a living selling tortillas and beans in her home. She sells them to neighbors. She has been in this business for ten years, which has enabled her to support her family. She will invest the loan in buying raw materials such as maize, lime, beef, beef bones, raw beans, etc.

loans.use: to invest in buying raw materials such as maize, lime, beef, beef bones, raw beans etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hypochlorite to manufacture bleach tablets.

loans.name: Nimrod

texts.en:
Nimrod is a 35-year-old man who is married to Erin and has five children: Yeni, who is ten and in grade four; Yohana who is nine and in the second grade; Adeputra, seven, who is in grade one; and Riniati and Imanuel who are just five and three.

In addition to being a laborer, Nimrod and his wife also sell “Cucur”, traditional cakes which are made of melted sugar. The problem the couple face is that they don't have a vehicle to distribute the cakes around their native island of Sabu.

Nimrod would like to buy a motorbike and he has applied for a loan from TLM for the amount of 7,000,000 Indonesian rupiahs (IDR) to purchase a second-hand one. He will use the motorbike to distribute cakes to schools and also offer a motorbike taxi service on the island. Nimrod hopes this venture will help provide his children with a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase a second hand motorbike for food deliveries

loans.name: Okari

texts.en:
Okari is a 41-year-old man, married to Hellen, and blessed with three children. He owns a curios shop and has been in this business for ten years. He gets a monthly income of KES 50,000 (Kenyan shillings).

This will be Okari's third loan with Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET). He plans to use the entire loan to purchase materials for making curios. He wants to expand the business and to educate his children. In the future, Okari wants to be a prosperous businessman.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make curios for his business.

loans.name: Espoir Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ESPOIR est composé de trois personnes qui sont des cohabitantes. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pierrette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pierrette est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Pierrette  un peu fréquenté l’école. Pierrette ne vit plus avec son mari. Pierrette a deux enfants tous à sa charge. Pierrette vit seule avec ses enfants. Pierrette assure seule les besoins de sa famille. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de sa famille, Pierrette mène comme activité principale la vente des fruits depuis dix ans. De façon secondaire Pierrette vend de la nourriture(pâte de maïs, riz). Pierrette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu,  Pierrette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ESPOIR, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The “Espoir” [“Hope”] group is composed of three individuals who live in the same house. They are requesting financial support from ALIDé for the second time, in order to expand their business. The group’s representative, by the name of Pierrette, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Pierrette is 38 years old and lives in Benin. She has had little formal schooling. Pierrette is separated from her husband. She has two dependent children. She lives by herself with her children. Pierrette alone provides for her household needs. In order to support her family, she has been selling fruits as her main line of business for some 10 years. In addition, she also sells cooked food (corn mush, rice). Pierrette stocks up at a market in Benin. In order to meet customer demand and expand her sales volume and her revenues, Pierrette, along with the other members of the Espoir group, is seeking a second loan from ALIDe. The first loan has been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, vegetable oil and condiments.

loans.name: Marie Helene's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 26 femmes fait partie du Banc Villageois qui a été crée le 18 décembre 2008. Il est composé de femmes ayant une bonne cohésion sociale et exerçant pratiquement la même activité, qui est le commerce.
Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, Suzanne est âgée de 51 ans. Elle célibataire et mère de 5 enfants dont 1 garçons.
Elle fait du commerce comme activité. Elle détient une cantine au lycée qui se trouve pas loin de son quartier. Elle y vend du thiakry, du jus de fruits, des beignets et du sandwich. Elle dépense tous les 25000f pour faire ses achats nécessaires. 
Les bénéfices obtenus lui permettent de prendre en charge sa famille. D'améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants
texts.en:
This group of 26 women belongs to a Banc Villageois created on December 18, 2008. It consists of women with a strong social bond, and who practically all work in trade. 

Suzanne, age 51, is the one standing at the far right with her hand raised. She is the single mother of five children, one of them a boy. She works in trade, and has a canteen at the college near her district where she sells thiakry (a West-African dessert made with millet), fruit juices, beignets and sandwiches. 

She will spend all of her 25,000f to purchase the necessary supplies. The profits earned will help her to support her family and to improve her children’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy millet, sugar, and other ingredients needed to prepare meals at her canteen.

loans.name: Saima Group

texts.en: Saima is a 35-year-old responsible married mother living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and five children. Her husband is a government employee and three of her children are currently studying in schools. Her husband’s income is not enough to meet the household and educational expenses of their children and they are facing many hurdles in life. Saima has been helping her husband by running a clothing business from her house for the past five years. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. The main purpose of the loan is to buy new varieties of clothing at a cheaper rate and then sell them for a profit. In the future she is looking forward to opening a small boutique in the market. She will save some money from the profits and pay the educational expenses of her children. She has a bright vision and this loan could help her to fulfill her dreams. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to purchase new varieties of clothing to sell

loans.name: Dayae

texts.en:
Dayae is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married, and has four children. Dayae works hard to provide his family’s income while his wife takes care of their children.

Dayae owns a small shop and sells fruits and vegetables. His shop is known as one of the best shops in the neighborhood, thanks to the cheap and clean products that he offers. Dayae established his business in 2010 and has gained good experience in what he practices. 

Dayae is requesting a loan of USD 2,000 which he will use to pay the annual rent of his shop and to buy more vegetables to sell. He believes that this loan will effectively improve his current financial conditions and he will be able to educate his children and grant them a good future.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop and to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
Yan is a villager from a rural area located in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. Yan is 52 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She earns a living through farming rice and growing sesame while her husband is a paid worker. Together, they can earn about KHR 38,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for their future needs. 
This is the second microloan with VisionFund. She successfully repaid the previous loan with VisionFund. The loan from VisionFund has helped her better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to timely grow her rice so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is 61 years old and married with six children.

Gregoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gregoria has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Gregoria aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cintya Carolina

texts.es:
Cinthia Carolina de 27 años de edad, soltera. Es originaria de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central del país. Cinthia se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, responsable con buenas costumbres, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar con su familia de actividades recreativas como cocinar un plato típico de la región como es el “ Indio Viejo” lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria por falta de recursos económicos, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar trabajo social.
Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de shampoo, de café, de salsas  de tomates, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevo, detergente, jabón, jugos, galletas, tiste, refrescos naturales. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Cinthia Carolina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Cinthia Carolina is 27 years old and single. She is from Managua, located in the centre of the country. Cinthia can be described as a hard-working responsible person with good habits and a desire to better herself. In her free time, she enjoys having fun with her family doing activities such as cooking a regional dish of the region such as “Indio Viejo”, a soup with vegetables and corn. Unfortunately, because of a lack of money she could not go to university, but she would have liked to study social work.
Thanks to her spirit and desire to succeed she has a grocery store located in her home. It is a small store selling items in small quantities such as shampoo, coffee, tomato sauces, rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, washing up liquid, soap, juices, biscuits, tiste (a traditional chocolate and corn drink), and fruit drinks. She serves at her store for around 10 hours every day offering her products. 
The aim of her loan is to invest in working capital and stock her store so that in the not too distant future she can boost her profits. Cinthia Carolina is grateful for the help provided by Kiva lenders to people of limited means and poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her store with products such as shampoo, coffee, tomato sauces, rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, washing up liquid, soap, juices, biscuits, tiste and fruit drinks.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en: As the married parent of seven children, Leonarda works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and is requesting a loan for PHP 18,000 from NWTF to buy raw materials for her tailoring business. Leonarda has taken out six previous loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her reach her dream of expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Fourat

texts.en:
Fourat is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has two children. Fourat is the sole provider for the family.
Fourat owns an upholstery business. He specializes in upholstering mattresses on demand. He has been in this field since his childhood, and used to help his father who had a similar shop. In 2000, Fourat established his own business and now he has an employee. He has gained an excellent reputation for providing his clients affordable prices.
Fourat is requesting a loan of $1,200 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent of his shop. Fourat is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop

loans.name: Ota

texts.en:
Ota is 60 years old. He and his wife are poor people and have three children. He is very hardworking and kind-natured. He has a lot of friends and all of them love him very much.
Ota has been farming for 18 years, producing crops and pepper. He has been in this line of work since he was a boy, so all of his experience has been dedicated to producing crops. His products are sold at the local market in the city. 
In order to provide his crops with the needed attention, Ota is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 7000 somoni so that he can buy fertilizer and to pay for rental land and continue improving his crop production. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay rent for land

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: This time, Francisca is applying for a new loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. Her general store business was previously funded through NWTF, a Kiva partner, to help provide Francisca and her family with an increased income that improved their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft drinks, sardines, sugar and other groceries.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 32-year-old married Iraqi man with three children. He is the sole provider of his family and owns a small garage, where he changes car engine oils. He established his business in 2000 and gained experience through previously working at a similar garage. Adnan now has his own independent business and has hired two employees already. His business is greatly growing in fame and reputation, thanks to the special kindness that he shows his customers.

Adnan is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD, which he will use to buy equipment for his work and to increase his oil inventories. Through this loan, he believes that his business will be improved, his revenues increased, and that he will be able to educate his children and provide them with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy equipment and to increase his oil inventories

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet Aminata. She is in her late thirties, from Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone. She is married, with three children between the ages of four and nine years. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

In 2003, Aminata established her palm oil business. She began her business because she needs to get income for her daily feeding. She works at the business ten hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are a poor road network in her operation area and lack of finances to run her business.

Aminata requires a loan in order to buy more gallons of palm oil. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to change her business to a general merchandise shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 30 years old, married and the father of three children who are 1, 5 and 12 years old. For the last 14 years, he has earned a living by raising livestock and earns KES. 15,000 from his business. He is requesting his second loan, for KES. 70,000, from KADET LTD to buy more livestock, including sheep, goats and heifers, to raise on his farm. He will use the additional income he earns to repay this loan, to cover the cost of paying for his children's education and to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Cindy Daniela

texts.es: Ella es Daniela decidió estudiar enfermería en ves de pedagogía infantil el cual era su sueño, ella vivió con sus abuelas desde los siete años con ellas, siempre le contaban historias y vivía muy feliz junto a ellas. Un día una de ellas se quejaba mucho de un dolor abdominal, la llevaron al medico le dijeron en varias ocasiones que no era nada, luego de diferentes exámenes y al tener los resultados le detectaron Cáncer luego poco a poco se fue enfermando un día de esos tuvo un sueño con su abuela y al día siguiente su abuela murió, le alisto la ropa y la llevaron a la funeraria, la peino, la maquillo, la puso como una princesa y le prometió que estudiaría enfermería porque quiere tratar de ayudar a las personas que por algún inconveniente tienen una enfermedad terminal y ayudarles a mejorar un poco su padecimiento
texts.en: This is Daniela.  She decided to study nursing instead of teaching young children which had always been her dream.  She lived with her grandmothers since she was 7 and they always told her stories and lived happily together.  One day one of her grandmothers complained of an abdominal pain, they took her to the doctors but they told her several times that it was nothing.  After receiving the results of several other exams they found cancer.  As her grandmother slowly became sicker Daniela had a dream one day with her grandmother and the next day her grandmother died.  They dressed and did her grandmother’s nails and makeup to prepare her for her funeral.  She looked like a princess, and Daniela promised her grandmother that she would study nursing in order to try to help ease the suffering of people with terminal illnesses.

loans.use: to finish her nursing program

loans.name: Gloria Estela

texts.es:
La Señora Gloria, de 39 años, vive con su esposo y dos hijos en su casa de habitación ubicada en una aldea de San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 9 años a la venta de productos alimenticios en todas sus presentaciones,  
Doña Gloria su negocio está ubicado en  su casa, está solicitando  el préstamo  para la compra de  mas productos alimenticios como manteca, huevos, aceite, papel higiénico, pollo, carne, embutidos, pastas de tomate, espaguetis, refrescos, etc.  
Doña Gloria con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende incrementar mas su inventario y poder tener todo los productos que sus clientes le demandan y así salir adelante con todos sus compromisos
Doña Gloria su sueño es educar a sus hijos.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo  del 2013.
texts.en:
Gloria, 39, lives with her husband and two children in her house located in a town in San Lorenzo, in the southern part of Honduras.  She has sold all types of food products for nine years.  Gloria's business is located in her house.

She's requesting the loan to buy more food products such as shortening, eggs, oil, toilet paper, chicken, meat, cold cuts, tomato paste, spaghetti, soft drinks, etc.

With the support of this loan Gloria plans to increase her inventory and have all the products her customers request, so she can fulfill her commitments.

Gloria's dream is for her children to get an education.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, March 2013

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Jose Oscar

texts.es:
El señor Jose óscar 33 de años de edad es soltero vive en casa propia en una comunidad de San Lorenzo valle, al sur de Honduras, se dedica a la compra y venta de materiales de construcción como ser ladrillo y tejas su actividad es una ves por semana y el resto del tiempo se dedica a visitar las persona que estan en proceso de construir vivienda es donde el aprovecha la oportunidad para ofrecerles los materiales.
Don Jose Oscar  se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 2 años viaja en su vehículo por todos los barrios y colonias del municipio en busca de construcciones, sus amigos y vecinos lo admiran por ser una persona luchadora.
Don Jose Oscar  está solicitando  el préstamo  para  comprar repuesto para su vehículo como ser aceites  y amortiguadores porque que necesita repararlo para trasportar los materiales, es su herramienta principal de trabajo. 
Don Jose Óscar con el apoyo de este préstamo desea seguir como siempre con su trabajo, su deseo es cada día obtener más clientes.
Don Jose Oscar  su sueño es comprarse un vehículo de un año más reciente.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2013.
texts.en:
Thirty-three year-old Jose Oscar is unmarried and lives in his own home in a community in San Lorenzo valley, in southern Honduras. 

He earns a living buying and selling construction materials such as bricks and roofing tiles. He carries out this activity once a week. He uses the rest of his time to visit people who are constructing their homes and takes the opportunity to offer them his materials. Jose Oscar has been in this business for 2 years. In his vehicle he drives through all of the neighbourhoods and districts in the city in search of construction sites. His friends and neighbours admire him for his determination. 

Jose Oscar is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle such as oil and shock-absorbers because he needs to repair it to transport the materials. It is his main work tool. 

With the support of this loan Jose Oscar hopes to continue on as always with his work. He hopes to obtain new clients every day. Jose Oscar's dream is to buy a newer vehicle. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2013.

loans.use: to purchase oil and shock absorbers for his business.

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es:
La  Señora  María Catalina 48 años, vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 25  años a la venta comida como ser filete de camarón , filete de pescado, coctel de curiles, carne asadas etc. 
Doña María su negocio ubicado en su casa, donde sus clientes son amigos y personas que transitan por su casa. 
Doña María está solicitando el préstamo para compra de pescado, carne, papas, yuca, plátanos, cebollas, chiles, repollo, lechuga, etc. y así surtir más su negocio,  su clientela a aumentado y les están pidiendo  diversidad de platillos de comida y así poder obtener más ganancias.
Doña María con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende suplir su necesidad financiera. 
Doña María su sueño es que su restaurante sea mas grande y poder asi atender a mas clientes.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Marzo del 2013.
texts.en:
María Catalina, 48, lives with her husband in her house located in a community in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.  For 25 years she has made a living selling food such as shrimp filet, fish filet, "curil" clam cocktail, grilled meat, etc.  María's business is located in her house and her customers are friends and people who are walking by.

María's requesting the loan to buy fish, meat, potatoes, yuca, plantains, onion, chili peppers, cabbage, lettuce, etc., to supply her business.

Her clientele has increased and they're requesting a variety of dishes, and this way she'll earn more profit.  María plans to take care of her financial need with the help of this loan.

María's dream is to expand her restaurant so that she can serve more customers.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, March 2013

loans.use: to buy food supplies

loans.name: Yafed

texts.en: Yafed is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kupang with his wife and three children. His two older children are in school while his youngest child is not yet old enough to attend school. He earns a living by buying old coconuts from farmers in nearby villages and making and selling coconut oil and copra (or coconut meat). His goal is to grow his business so he can earn enough money to better support his family. To make this possible, he is requesting a loan for IDR 5,000,000 to buy more coconuts. His goal for the future is to provide a better life to his children.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to make coconut oil and meat.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 42 years old, married, and has three children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 45,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en: Faustin is 40 years old. He is the father of five children, all of whom go to school. He owns a bar where he sells barbecue and beer. With the loan, he will buy more beer and mineral water for sale in his bar. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more beer and mineral water for sale.

loans.name: Delia Arely

texts.es: Delia, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, y vive en el municipio de la Masica, Atlántida.  Ella se ha dedicado al comercio de venta de ropa, pero hace 7 meses decidió establecer una pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica como granos básicos, lácteos, jugos, productos de limpieza, refrescos etc.  El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 5,000 lempiras y los utilizara para comprar más productos alimenticios y surtir la pulpería como granos basicos, lacteos, jugos, refrescos etc. Su plan es mantener el negocio surtido para aumentar las ventas y las ganancias y que sus hijos puedan graduarse y siempre tengan lo mejor.
texts.en:
Delia is a 36-year old married woman who has three children and lives in the municipality of la Masica, Atlántida. She used to work in clothing sales, but decided to start her own grocery store seven months ago. She sells basic products, such as basic grains, dairy products, juices, cleaning items, sodas, etc. 

She is requesting a loan of 5,000 HNL that she will use to buy more food products for her store, including basic grains, dairy products, juices and sodas. Her plan is to keep the store well stocked to increase sales and earnings so that her children will be able to graduate and always have the best available to them.

loans.use: to buy food products for her grocery store, such as basic grains, dairy products, juices, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Silvia Maria

texts.es: Silvia Maria casada con tres hijos, del domicilio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del pais, silvia se dedica a la venta de mercaderia en general venta de ropa como:ropa juvenil, adultos, cosmeticos, zapatos, prendas de oros, plata, chinerias, adornos entre otros ella realiza sus compras en Managua capital, vende a comerciantes de Leon Y chinandega tiene clientes fijos y eventuales la mayor parte las da a credito y las recupera quincenal y semanalmente, toda su mercaderia siempre esta en cuentas por cobrar ya que ella entrega la mayor parte a sus clientes fijos debido a esto es que su demanda ha incremantado ya que ella ofrece buenos precios a sus clientes y excelente calidad de mercaderia, Silvia esta muy agradecidas con los inversionistas kivas ya que ellos ha logrado ir mejorando su vivienda y dandole una mejor vida a sus hijos, ella desde muy temprano se levanta y se va a entregar mercaderia y a la misma vez va recuperando su ganacias. Silvia esta solicitando este credito para capital de trabajo para incrementar mas su negocio y asi ofrecerle nuevos productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Silvia María is married and has three children.  She lives in Chinandega, in the western part of the country.

Silvia makes a living selling general merchandise such as clothing for children and adults, cosmetics, shoes, gold jewelry, silver, knick knacks, decorations, etc.  She makes her purchases in Managua, the capital of the country, and sells to vendors in León and Chinandega.  She has steady and occasional customers.  She leaves the majority on credit and collects biweekly and weekly.

All her merchandise is in accounts receivable because she delivers most of it to her regular customers.  This is why her demand has increased, because of the good prices she offers her customers and the excellent quality of the merchandise.

Silvia's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because she has managed to keep on improving her home and giving her children a better life.  She gets up very early and goes out to deliver merchandise.  She's also recovering her earnings.

Silvia's requesting this loan for working capital to increase her business more and to offer her customers new products.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and other merchandise

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es: carlos vive con su familia y su esposa en casa propia se dedica a la venta de juguetes desde hace varios años, y con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda a su familia y cubre algunos gastos personales comercia de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela, carlos solicita un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia (juguetes) como burbujas, mascaras, lamparas, carritos, rompecabezas, muñecos, entre otras cosas asi como muestra la fotografia y asi poder seguir ayudando en su casa y tener mejores ganancias para sus gastos personales.
texts.en: Carlos lives with his family and his wife in a house which they own.  He has sold toys for a number of years and uses his earnings to help his family and cover some of his personal expenses.  He travels around the area close to where he lives selling his goods and has a large clientele.  Carlos is applying for this loan to buy more merchandise (toys) such as bubbles, masks, torches, toy cars, puzzles, dolls, among other things such as those shown in the photo.  This will enable him to continue to contribute to the running of the household and to make more money for his personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy toys in bulk

loans.name: Ligia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ligia del Socorro de 53 años de edad, soltero con dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Originario de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central de la región. Ligia se caracteriza por ser una persona, trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le disfrutar de tiempo de calidad para ella, relajarse leyendo o viendo televisión. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos de su hogar.

Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería como zapatos, de niños de adultos, sandalias, crema corporales. Actividad que la desempeña de forma ambulante, con un bulto den su cabeza de unos 20 kg ofreciendo su mercadería a clientes fijos y eventuales, el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Ligia del Socorro agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Ligia del Socorro is 53 years old, and is single with two children still living with her. She is from Managua, located in the center of the country. Ligia is known for being a hard-working, responsible person, who seeks personal improvement. In her free time, she likes to relax by reading or watching television. Unfortunately, she could not study at university, instead having to work from a young age to help out with household expenses.

Thanks to her spirit and her will to succeed, she makes a living selling goods such as shoes for children and adults, sandals and body lotions. She sells these products from door to door, carrying a weight of 20kg on her head, offering her goods to regular and possible customers. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business, so that in the not too distant future she can boost her profits. Ligia del Socorro is grateful for the help provided by Kiva lenders to people of limited means and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a dignified job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business with merchandize such as shoes for children and adults, sandals and body lotions.

loans.name: Raksa's Group

texts.en:
Raksa, 26, lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She is a married mother of two children. Her family’s income is from leasing a rice paddy of two hectares and planting sesame. Sometimes, her husband works for others as a paid laborer. Raksa has been in the farming business for 10 years, to make a living. From the current business, she can earn about KHR 22,000 per day, and she manages to save about KHR 16,000 per day for future needs.

Raksa has been a member of VisionFund for two loan cycles already, and she completely repaid the loans. She used those previous loans from VisionFund successfully, to better support her living. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use part of her share of the loan funds to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland, and use another part of it to buy gasoline for water pumping. With the profits of this loan, she hopes to extend her farmland to increase her business, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm, and gasoline for water pumping

loans.name: Zelmira Ramona

texts.es: Zelmira Ramona de 38 años de edad, casada, originaria de Chinandega, con tres hijos uno estudiante de educación primaria y dos de educación secundaria, están aun bajo el cargo de ella, es mujer luchadora que desde hace quince años  se dedica a la comercializacion de mariscos (camaron), para abastecerse le compra a productores de la zona de Mechapa, Aserradores, Morazan y en ocaciones a mayoristas que vienen de la Costa atlantica, sus clientes son vendedores del mercado central de Chinandega, Leon, Chichigalpa, Managua y cuando tiene volumen de inventario, le vende a la empresa Neptuno,  también habilita granjas pequeñas de camaron y están por iniciar la cosecha, solicita este financiamiento  para capital de trabajo, ya que comprara 1000 libras de camarones y poder abstecer las necesidades demandades de sus clientes.
texts.en: Zelmira Ramona, 28, married, is originally from Chinandega. She has three children that depend on her; one goes to primary school and two to secondary school. Zelmira is a hardworking woman that has been selling seafood (shrimp) for fifteen years. She buys from producers in the areas of Mechapa, Aserradores and Morazan and sometimes from wholesalers that come from the Pacific Coast. Her customers are salespeople from the main marketplace in Chinandega, Leon, Chichigalpa or Managua. When she has enough inventory, she sells to a company called Neptuno. Zelmira also runs small shrimp farms that are about to start their “harvest”. She is requesting a loan to improve her working capital and buy 1000 pounds of shrimp, in order to be able to satisfy the orders her customers have made.

loans.use: to buy 1,000 pounds of shrimp.

loans.name: Mivo Group

texts.fr: MIVO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe du nom de Falilatou(dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 51 ans. Falilatou est mariée à un certain Tamaman. Falilatou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés dont un reste à leur charge. Falilatou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Falilatou vend des tissus par la méthode de distribution. Falilatou s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profits, Falilatou sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MIVO un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
MIVO is a group made up of three people who all belong to the same "tontine" group. The group's representative, Falilatou (who is raising her hand in the photo), is 51 years old. Falilatou is married to a man named Tamaman. Falilatou did not go to school. Falilatou and Tamaman have two children, all of whom have received schooling. One of their children remains in their care. Falilatou lives with her husband and children. Both she and her husband cover the various household expenses.

In order to keep up with the various expenses, Falilatou sells fabric through the distribution system. She stocks up in a town in Benin.

Striving to better respond to the demands of her ever growing customer base and earn greater profits, Falilatou, along with the other members of the MIVO group, is seeking a loan from ALIDé for the first time.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 53-year-old man who is married to Yuniah. He is the father of three children and he is a farmer. He has been in this business for two years now and earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

This will be his first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizers. He wants to expand his business and educate his children. 

In the future, Samson wants to become a prosperous businessman so that he can improve his living standard.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa de su madre con sus 2 hermanos, el se dedica a la venta de agua de coco cerca de su lugar de residencia  es muy reconocido en la zona pues tiene 3 años de trabajar en la venta de agua de coco  tiene mucha clientela pues los da a buen precio, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar cubrir algunos gastos que se presentan en su familia,  El cliente desea incrementar su ventas  por eso solicita un crédito para poder comprar cocos por mayor y seguir ayudando a su familia como siempre lo ha hecho sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: The borrower lives in his mother's house with his 2 siblings. He sells coconut water near his place of residence. He is very well-known in the area since he has been selling coconut water for 3 years. He has many customers because his prices are good. With the earnings from his sales he is able to cover some of his family's expenses. The borrower wants to increase his sales, so he is asking for a loan in order to be able to buy wholesale coconuts and continue helping his family as he has always done without restriction.

loans.use: to buy wholesale coconuts to sell the coconut water

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente es un hombre muy  trabajador, vive con su esposa y su hijas, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos de los gastos que tiene en su hogar. El cliente solicita un préstamo para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga y fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
The client is a very hardworking man.  He lives with his wife and children.  He works very hard on his own plot of land where he grows corn and beans.  His products are of very good quality.  With the profits from his sales he manages to cover some of his household expenses.

He's requesting a loan to have the money he needs to invest in buying agricultural supplies such as pest control and fertilizer, soil amendments, seed, and other things for his crop.

He hopes to increase his sales to be able to get greater profits and give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, soil amendments, seed, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Elvira Yesenia

texts.es: Doña Elvira es comerciante, vive con su familia en casa propia y elabora antojitos (papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, tamales, etc) que vende de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza ha logrado solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña elvira pide financiamiento para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboracion de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, maiz para los tamales, platanos y todo los ingredientes para su elaboracion y una nueva cocina y asi poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar.
texts.en: Elvira is a businesswoman.  She lives with her family in her own home and she makes snacks (fries, fried yucca, empanadas, tamales, etc.) that she sells on foot close to where she lives.  She has been able to cover her household expenses thanks to her sales.  Elvira is asking for a loan to buy the products she uses to make her snacks, such as oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, bananas, and all the ingredients for cooking, as well as a new stove.  This will allow her to keep supporting her household and be able to cover any expenses that might arise.

loans.use: to buy products such as oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, bananas, and all the ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente es una persona muy amable, responsable y trabajadora vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su bebe de 8 meses el se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa y su esposa trabaja en un ciber cafe con las ventas que realiza y con la ayuda de su esposa logran cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar tiene mucha clientela pues vende ropa de calidad y de buena marca por eso el cliente solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar mas mercaderia como camisas, ropa interior, calcetines, pantalones y comprar zapatos y asi surtir con mucha variedad su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y pueda seguirle dando a su familia todo lo que necesitan sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
The client is a very kind, responsible, and hard-working person.  He lives in his own house with his life partner and his eight month old baby.

He sells all types of clothes, and his wife works at a cyber café.  With the sales that he makes, and with the help of his wife, they manage to cover some household expenses.  He has a lot of clientele.  He sells quality and good brand clothes.  

He is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy more merchandise like shirts, underwear, socks, pants, and shoes.  This way he will stock his business with a lot of variety.  He will do this in order to get more profits and to be able to continue giving his family everything they need without limitation.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like shirts, underwear, socks, pants, and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa de un familiar con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa y lenceria en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de sus esposo logran cubrir los gastos que tienen en su hogar, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio con mas mercaderia paro no tiene suficiente capital para poder realizarlo por eso solicta un credito que le permita comprar mas: camisas, pantalones, blusas, faldas, lenceria entre otras cosas para obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
The client lives in the family house with her husband and their two children.  She sells all types of clothing and lingerie at the market that is close to her home.

With the profits that she gets, and with her husband’s help, they manage to cover their household expenses.

The client wishes to make her business grow with more merchandise.  However, she does not have enough capital to be able to do so.  That is why she is requesting a loan.  The loan will allow her to buy more shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, and lingerie, among other things.  She will do this in order to get more income and to give her family what they need without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy clothes like skirts, shirts, and pants, etc.

loans.name: Hector Asael

texts.es: Don hector vive en casa propia con su esposa, sus dos hijos y su padre, el tiene un negocio de venta de madera en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años tambien se dedica a la agricultura siembra maiz y frijol, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, el solicita nuevamente un credito pero esta vez para la compra de madera por mayor ya que tiene mucha clientela pues lo buscan porque la madera que vende es de calidad tambien la vende a comercios que la utilizan para hacer puertas, marcos para fotos, para hacer muebles, entre otras cosas y asi pueda tener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Hector lives in his own house with his wife, their two children, and his father.  He has had a business selling wood out of his home for several years and he also farms corn and beans.  With the sales that he makes, he is able to cover the home expenses.

He requests a loan that will allow him to buy wood wholesale.  He already has a lot of customers that seek him out because the wood that he sells is of the the highest quality.  He also sells to businesses that use the wood to make doors, picture frames, furniture, and other things.  In doing this, he will be able to have better profits and to give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta vive en casa de la suegra con su esposo ella posee una tienda donde vende todo tipo de productos, jugos, gaseosas, golosinas, granos basicos, etc. tiene varios años de tener su negocio en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos de los gastos que tiene en su casa, tiene mucha clientela pues la buscan porque tiene variedad de productos para vender, ella esta solicitando un credito que le permita comprar: cereales, granos basicos, detergentes, gaseosas, jugos,lacteos, entre otras cosas para aumentar su ventas y asi tener una mejor vida con su esposo.
texts.en: The client lives with her husband in her mother-in-law's house. For a number of years, she has had a shop in the house where she sells all kinds of merchandise: juices, sodas, candies, basic grains, and more. She is able to pay some household expenses with the profit from her sales. She has a lot of customers because she carries a wide range of merchandise. She has applied for a loan to buy cereals, basic grains, detergents, sodas, juices, milk products, and other items to increase sales and have a better life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy candies, sodas, juices, etc

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, canchos para el cabello entre otras cosas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicta un credito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, esmaltes para uñas, desodorantes y tambien desea comprar ropa ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solictada ella podra obtener mejores ganancias y asi seguira dandole a su famili lo que necesita sin limitacion alguna
texts.en:
This borrower works selling all kinds of personal products like lotions, deodorant, hair pins, and other items. Her business is located in her home. With the earnings she makes from her sales and her husband's help, they manage to cover their household expenses. She lives in her own home with her husband and children. 

This borrower wants to increase her business, so she is requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase everything she needs, like fragrances, nail polish, deodorant, and she also wants to buy clothing. She has a large customer base because she sells her products at affordable prices. The help she is requesting will allow her to obtain higher earnings so that she can continue to give her family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase fragrances, hair pins, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Carmen Beatriz

texts.es: Carmen vive con esposo y su hijo de tres años en casa propia, ella es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y muy emprendedora, desde hace varios años se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maiz y frijol va almacenando sus cosechas en los sacos que muestra la fotografia para luego salir a venderlos en los mercados que estan cerca de su residencia tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, Doña Carmen ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus cultivos ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes, herbisidas, semillas, entre otras cosas necesarias para su cultivo que le permita crecer en el negocio. Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en:
Carmen lives with her husband and her three-year-old son in her own house.  She's a hardworking, responsible, and very enterprising woman.

She has made a living in agriculture for several years.  Her main crop is corn and beans.  She stores her harvests in the sacks shown in the photograph and later goes out to sell them in the markets near her house.  She has very good customers because she has learned how to earn their trust.  She offers quality and good prices in her products.

Carmen has decided to invest in taking care of her crops because it's her only form of income.  This is why she has requested a loan to be able to buy soil amendments, pesticide, fertilizer, herbicide, seed, and other things she needs for her crop that will allow her to grow in her business.

She hopes this will give her favorable results so she can continue giving her household the financial help it needs so much.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, fertilizer, seed, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su hijo y su esposo en casa propia ella se dedica a vender productos de uso personal de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia como: permufes, desodorantes, cremas, etc. desde hace 3 años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir los gastos de su hogar, La clienta solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar mas mercaderia para surtir su negocio con mas: permumes, desodorantes, comprar shampoo, entre otras cosas para obtener mejores ingresos y poderle dar a su familia una mejor vida sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in her own home with her husband and child. She sells personal use products as a street vendor near her home. The borrower has been selling perfumes, deodorants, crèmes, and other products for three years. With the income she generates from her sales and her husband’s earnings, they are able to cover the household expenses.

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise for restocking her business such as perfumes, deodorants, shampoo, and other products. This will enable her to generate more income so that she can provide a better life for her family without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, deodorants, shampoo, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente es una persona muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 1 año de edad, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maiz y maicillo sus productos son de muy buena calidad con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, el cliente solicita un credito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas como pesticidas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra y tambien para poder darle una mejora al terreno que muestra en la fotografia que es donde siembra, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
The client is a very friendly and hardworking person. He lives with his wife and one-year-old child. He works very hard on his own parcel of land where he cultivates corn and sorghum. His products are very good quality. He manages to pay household expenses from the sale of his crops.

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase farming supplies, such as pesticides, fertilizer, compost and seeds, among other items that he needs for cultivation. He also wants to be able to make improvements to his land. The parcel that he cultivates is shown in the photograph. He longs to increase his sales so that he can earn more income and provide his family with better economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, compost, etc and to improve his land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair clips and bands.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 6 años, La clienta esta solicitando un credito que le permita poder comprar productos para la elbaoracion de las pupusas como: quesillo, chacharron, maiz, tomastes, entre otras cosas ya que tiene mucha clientela y asi ella podra obtener mejores ingresos que le ayudaran en su hogar y atener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This client has sold pupusas [Salvadorian national dish of corn tortillas with cheese, meat, or bean filling] for several years based out of her home. With the earnings she makes, she is able to pay for the household expenses. She lives with her husband and 6 year old child. She is requesting a loan that would allow her to purchase ingredients to make pupusas such as melting cheese, pork rind, corn, tomatoes, and other ingredients that she needs. She already has many customers and by selling pupusas, she can make a better income that would help in her home and help her achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase melting cheese, pork rind, corn flour, and other pupusa ingredients

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es: Don Jose de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace varios años con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos de los gastos de su hogar, tiene mucha clientela por eso quiere comprar mas cerdos para su crianza pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos por eso Don Jose solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar mas cerdos para su venta y asi obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su esposa
texts.en: 48-year-old Jose lives in his own house with his wife. For several years he has raised pigs. With the sales that he makes, he has succeeded in covering some of the household expenses. He has a large customer base, which is why he wants to buy more pigs to raise. However, what he earns is not enough to be able to cover this expense. Therefore, Jose is requesting a loan that will allow him to be able to buy more pigs for sale, and in this way obtain greater profit and have more financial stability with his wife.

loans.use: to buy more pigs for sale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 28 years old and married, and she has three children between ages 3 and 10. She runs a general store in Tombo Western rural area, in Sierra Leone. She started this business to get her daily living.

She's been in this business since 2008, and she sells soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits to her community.  She says that the main problem to her business is poor electricity to cool her drinks.

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits to resell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to grow her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits to resell.

loans.name: Vutna's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Vutna is 42 years old and married. She has three dependent children, two of whom are still in school. The main source of her family’s income is from corn and rice cultivation. To supplement the income, her husband works for others for a fee. Having been in the farming business for 10 years, she is able to earn daily income of KHR 27,600 to support her family, and she can save about KHR 10,000 per day for future needs.

Vutna’s Group consists of two members who live in the same village. Vutna has been with VisionFund for two previous loans, and she completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. Vutna will use part of her share of this loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland, and use another part to pay for farm labor. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm, and to pay for farm labor

loans.name: Hector Ruben

texts.es:
El joven Héctor Rubén es un obrero que reside en la ciudad de Condega un pueblo ubicado a unos 35 km al norte de la ciudad de Estelí. Está felizmente casado con una jovencita que es propietaria y dependiente de una tienda que ofrece ropa de todos los estilos y por el momento no tiene hijo. Héctor junto a su esposa reside en su propia casa de habitación la que están mejorando a diario

Este joven trabaja a diario labora en una fabrica de Condega, en la elaboración de puros a base de tabaco, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 7 am hasta las 5 pm y los días sábado labora medio día. Esta es su principal fuente de ingreso para el sustento de su familia.

Este joven se presento a las oficinas de Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un financiamiento para realizarle una mejora a su casa de habitación.

 Dicha mejora consiste en la construcción de el servicio sanitario y su ducha.
El cliente dice que de ser aprobado este financiamiento seria un logro ya que le daría una mejor condición a su casa de habitación y de esta manera también mejoraría sus condiciones de vida y tener un hogar mas digno.
texts.en:
Young Héctor Rubén is a laborer who resides in the city of Condega, a town located 35 kilometers north of the city of Estelí. He is happily married to a young lady who is the owner and shopkeeper of a store offering clothing of all styles, and for the moment does not have any children. Héctor resides with his wife in their own home, which they are improving daily.

This young man works daily in a factory in Condega, developing tobacco-based cigars. He works from Monday to Friday from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. and half the day on Saturday. This is his primary source of income to support his family.

This young man turned up at the Ceprodel offices with the purpose of requesting financing in order to make improvements to his home. These improvements consist of the building of the bathroom and its shower.

He says that being approved for financing would be an achievement since it would give him better home conditions and in that way would also improve his life conditions and he would have a more dignified home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, bricks, etc. and to pay for labor for the construction of the bathroom

loans.name: Adolfo Damián

texts.es:
Achuapa un bello y encantado Municipio ubicado en el departamento de León, donde existen muchas personas emprendedora con deseo de superación. 

Adolfo Damián es conocido como una persona responsable y con mucho deseo de superación tiene 46 años edad Luchador por su vida y la de su familia, brinda su servicio como Responsable de bodega. 
Vive con su esposa y tres hijos bajo su cargo, su esposa es ama de casa, con lo poco que él gana como bodeguero, sostiene el sustento diario de su hogar.

Son de sus sueños  vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia, por tal razón solicita a Kiva y Ceprodel que le financie un crédito para la compra de una refrigeradora, esto sería de mucha importancia, después de un día cansado llegar a su hogar a tomarse un refresco helado. 

Agradece a Dios por haber encontrado a kiva y Ceprodel y tener la oportunidad de solicitar su primer crédito para este tipo de bien que quiere adquirir.
texts.en:
Achuapa is a beautiful and charming town located in the department of León, where there are a lot of enterprising people who want to improve themselves.

Adolfo Damián, 46, is known as a responsible person with a great desire for self-improvement.  He strives for his life and his family's.  He's responsible for the store.  He lives with his wife, who's a homemaker, and three dependent children.  He supports his family with what little he makes as a shopkeeper.

His dream is to have better living conditions for his family, so he's asking Kiva and CEPRODEL for a loan to buy a refrigerator.  This will be very important, to arrive home after a tiring day of work and have an ice-cold beverage.

He's grateful to God that he found Kiva and CEPRODEL and that he has the opportunity to request his first loan for this type of goods that he wants to acquire.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Víctor Eugenio

texts.es: Don Victor de 60 años de edad,  habita en casa propia con su esposa y sus 2 hijos.  Él se caracteriza por ser un hombre emprendedor, responsable y trabajador, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos  como frijol, maiz y sorgo. Con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar ya que ese negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos. Para él lo más importante es su familia y es por ella es que trabaja día con día desde tempranas horas de la mañana. Don Victor ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un credito para invertir en los insumos necesarios: semilla, venenos para plagas, abonos, pesticidas, herbicidas, etc. asi como muestra la fotografia y asi tendra buenas cosechas que le dejaran mejores ganancias y podra darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Víctor, 60, lives in his own house with his wife and two children.  He describes himself as an enterprising, responsible, and hardworking man.

He makes a living growing basic grains such as beans, corn, and sorghum.  With the profits from his sales he's able to cover the household expenses because that business is his main source of income.  The most important thing to him is his family, for whom he works every day from early in the morning.

Víctor has decided to request a loan to invest in the necessary inputs: seed, pesticide, soil amendments, herbicide, etc., as shown in the photograph.  This way he'll have good harvests that will yield him better profits and he'll be able to give his family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy seed, pesticide, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise such as perfumes, cosmetics, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, perfumes, entre otras cosas con las ventas que realiza logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar vive con su mama en una casa que alquilan, su negocio es de forma ambulante vende en los mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues lo buscan porque vende sus productos con precios accesibles, por eso el cliente solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar mas mercaderia: zapatos, pantalones, perfumes, desodorantes, lociones, entre otras cosas y surtir su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y seguir solventando los gastos que se le presentan en su casa.
texts.en:
The borrower sells clothing, shoes, perfumes and other articles to cover some of his household expenses.  He lives with his mother in a rented house and works as a street vendor in the markets near his home.  He has many customers who seek him out because of his low prices.

He is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise such as shoes, pants, perfumes, deodorants, lotions, etc., to stock his business and earn more profit.  This will allow him to continue taking care of household expenses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as shoes, pants, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su mama en casa de un familiar, ella tiene un negocio de venta de panes con mortadelas y pollo en su lugar de residencia con las ventas que obtiene logra cubrir los gastos de su casa, ella solicita un credito para poder comprar todos los ingredientes que utiliza para la elaboracion de sus panes como: mortaledas, mayonesa, curtido, panes, vegetales,pollo, tomates, entre otras cosas que utiliza y asi obtener mejores ganacias para seguir ayuando en los gastos de su casa.
texts.en:
This partner lives with her mother in a relative’s house. She has a business selling bread with sausages and chicken from her residence. With the money from her sales, she is able to cover her household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase all of the ingredients that she uses for making her bread, like: sausages, mayonnaise, seasoned vegetables, bread, vegetables, chicken, and tomatoes, among other things that she uses. In this way, she can obtain better earnings in order to continue helping with the expenses for her home.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making bread (tomatoes, sausages, chicken etc).

loans.name: Alexanders

texts.es: Alexanders es un microempresario emprendedor que se dedica a la venta y crianza de pollo en su comunidad de pacayita Masaya, tiene 29 años de edad, es acompañado y cuenta con dos hijos menores, desde hace un año se dedica a esa actividad, el crédito  lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos para pollos como purina, pollos tiernos, vacuna, desinfectantes, cal, antibióticos etc.
texts.en: Alexanders is an entrepreneurial small business owner who makes a living from selling and raising chickens in his community of Pacayita in Masaya. He is 29 years old, is in a relationship, and has two young children. He has made a living from this business for the past year. The loan will be invested in buying food for chickens like Purina, broiler chickens, vaccines, disinfectants, lime, antibiotics, etc.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens like Purina, broiler chickens, vaccines, disinfectants, lime, antibiotics, etc.

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en:
A 38-year-old mother of four children, Son resides in a rural village in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To support her standard of living, she has been farming rice on a two hectare of farmland for 15 years, while her husband is a paid worker. Together, they can earn about KHR18,000 per day, and can save about KHR10,000 each day for future needs.

Son’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle. Son successfully repaid the last loan, which helped her better support her family. 

Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan. Son wants to use her portion to purchase labor, fertilizer, and pesticides for her farmland. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income to make a better living.

loans.use: To purchase labor, fertilizer, and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco is 24 years old and single. He sells clothes, and has been in the business for eight years. 

He has requested a loan to buy more clothes, such as shirts and trousers, to sell. 

He plans to save the profits from the business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, such as shirts and trousers, to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente reside en casa de sus padres junto con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El cliente se dedica  a la venta de juegos de video y accesorios para telefonos. Su negocio lo tiene en su lugar de residencia y gracias a su amabilidad, creatividad y a la gran variedad de productos que mantiene ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes los cuales lo prefieren por ser un hombre responsable, trabajador y dedicado en su negocio. Ha decidido solicitar un crédito para comprar mayor variedad de juegos de video, estuches para telefonos, audifonos, carcasas entre otras cosas y poder surtir su negocio de tal manera que logre atraer a más clientes que le permitan mejorar su nivel de ventas así como su nivel de ingresos para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The borrower lives with his wife and children in his parent's home.  He sells videogames and phone accessories.  He works from home and thanks to his kindness, creativity and wide variety of products, he has been able to gain the confidence of many customers.  They prefer buying from him because he is a responsible, hard-working, dedicated man.
