El crédito lo requiere para aumento de capital y comprar más calcetines  al por mayor para de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Pastora es tener su casita propia.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Pastora is a single mother and has two children who are all in school. She lives in a rented house that is located in the district of Estrellas de Belén in the city of El Alto. 
Pastora finished secondary school and is currently running her own business selling clothing accessories, like socks, in the city of El Alto. 
She needs a loan because she wants to increase her working capital and to purchase more socks in bulk so that, in this way, she will be able to improve her earnings and her quality of life. 
Her dream is to have her own home. 
This is the first loan she is asking for with IMPRO and also her first with KIVA.

loans.use: purchase socks in bulk.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: EL Sr.  Guadalupe es   soltero tiene  43  años de edad, vive  en una casa de interés social con su   mamá   Cecilia  de  58 años , su  mamá es  viuda  desde  hace 5 años ;  actualmente  esta trabajando c omo ayudante en  una Carpinteria donde fabrican  cocinas Recamaras y más,    los Sabados y Domingos  ayuda   a su  mamá con la Venta de  Tamales que ella elabora  los fines de semana  salen a  entregar   a los Vecinos de la localidad , el dia de hoy está  solicitando el credito para la instalacion de un barandal para la  escalera ya que su  mamá ya es una persona adulta  y no quiere  que le pase un accidente . por tal motivo el  crédito lo quiere   para llevar a cabo este proyecto que beneficiara a  él y en especial a  su  mamá .
texts.en:
Guadalupe is single and 43 years old.  He lives in a shared interest house with his mother, Cecilia, who is 58 years old.  She has been a widow for five years.  

Currently, he works as an assistant in a carpentry workshop where they make kitchens, bedrooms, and more.  On Saturday and Sunday, he helps his mother sell tamales that she makes.  On the weekends, they go out and deliver them to neighbors in the area.  

He is requesting this loan to install a handrail on the stairs since his mother is an older person and he doesn't want her to have an accident.  For this reason, he want this loan to complete this project since it will benefit him and especially his mother.

loans.use: to install a handrail for the stairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a small shop in order to start a grocery business.

loans.name: Willson

texts.es:
Willson es casado y tiene tres hijos, un varón y dos mujeres que están en etapa escolar, vive en la casa propia donde cuenta con un ambiente y se encuentra el dormitorio y la cocina, baño, la  habitación es de adobe y el piso de cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Ventilla de la Ciudad del Alto.
Actualmente trabaja de chofer asalariado y la esposa también ayuda en el trabajo y al cuidado de los hijos,  ellos trabajan todos los días de la semana, ambos  colaboran en el pago de los servicios, comida y vestimenta, y educación de sus hijos.
El crédito lo requiere para mantenimiento y reparación de la movilidad que maneja ya que es su única fuente de ingreso, la ruta y el recorrido están llenos de tierra y polvo y el dueño de la movilidad le ha puesto como condición para seguir trabajando que el costo de mantenimiento del vehículo sea por cuenta de Willson.
El sueño de Willson es poder contar con movilidad propia que sea su herramienta que le facilitará mejorar sus ingresos y así  mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en: Willson is married with three school-aged children (one boy and two girls).  The house in which he lives is his own and has a living room, a bedroom, a kitchen and a bathroom.  The dwelling is made of adobe with a cement floor and is situated in the Ventilla district of Ciudad del Alto.   He currently works as a salaried driver and his wife also helps by doing the housework and looking after the children.  They work seven days a week, both of them contributing to the cost of paying the bills, buying food and clothing and educating their children.  He needs the loan to maintain and repair the car he drives, as this is his only source of income.  The roads and routes he covers are full of dirt and dust and the vehicle's owner told Willson that if he wants to continue working, he has to take responsibility for the car's maintenance costs.  Willson's dream is to own his own car so that he can increase his income and thereby improve his quality of life.  This is the first time that he has applied for a loan with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to cover maintenance costs of the passenger transport vehicle which Willson drives as a salaried driver.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover production costs, including prop design and set design, actors and make-up artists, and food for the production crew.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sales stall

loans.name: Tahiera

texts.en:
Tahiera of Birmingham, Alabama, successfully transformed herself from a victim of domestic violence into an advocate for men and women who struggle to build quality lives out of tragic circumstances.

Her 2006 book, “Annihilator of Innocence,” chronicles a horrific ordeal in which Tahiera, along with her children, were held hostage for two years by a deranged man. Though the story is written as fiction, it is a true account of what happened to Tahiera and her children. The experience left her in a coma, and although she eventually recovered, she still suffers from permanent amnesia.  

Despite her trauma, she has become a successful businesswoman whose work has touched people around the world, via online programming, public speaking and publishing.

She created Indian Creek Management LLC, under which she operates Darkness To Light Films, a movie and TV production company. She also is a professional speaker who shares her inspiring story at schools, universities, correctional facilities, law enforcement conferences and other venues. 

She currently produces an online talk show, "Living True and Truly Living: Real People ... Real Stories ... Real Issues,” spotlighting people who have overcome obstacles and found joy in life once again. She hopes to eventually bring this program to broadcast television.

She also has a new project in the planning stages - a film, "Annihilator of Innocence: The Barbara Clark Story," based on her book.  

Tahiera successfully applied for a Promesa loan from Accion Alabama, an extension of Accion Texas Inc., to produce the summer episodes of her talk show. The funds will pay for a director, production crew and for promotional merchandise to market the show.

“I am so grateful to Accion for helping me expand my platform and reach more people who need encouragement and hope,” Tahiera says. She adds that Accion’s belief in her will serve as an example to potential sponsors as she grows her talk show and film projects. “If other people see that Accion invested in me, then that can jumpstart interest among possible investors,” she says.

loans.use: to pay the director and production crew of her show, and for advertising the show.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a single mother and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a food business, where neighbours and town dwellers are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of changes in the number of clients which can cause perishable goods to go bad and a loss of money.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding into a modern café in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for inventory and purchase a website.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian, de 28 años de edad, esta casada con Jorge y vive cómodamente en su propia casa en compañía de sus padres, su esposo, sus dos hermanos y un sobrino.La actividad que tiene Lilian es la venta de bebidas gasificadas de diferentes marcas y sabores, además de parrilladas los sábados y domingos que vende en el frontis de su casa. Sus bebidas gasificadas son adquiridos al contando y son vendidos desde su casa a sus vecinos y transeúntes quienes son sus clientes habituales. Tiene más de 03 años dedicándose  a éste negocio y por el momento solo cuenta con el apoyo ocasional de su hermano,  quien atiende a los clientes cuando ella está fuera de casa.Tuvo dificultades pues la condición económica de su hogar era precaria, dificultándole el poder estudiar y entonces buscó un oficio al cual dedicarse y  empezó con su negocio. Le gusta su negocio por los ingresos económicos y el poder tener una ocupación, además el poder estar en la comodidad de su casa y contar con tiempo disponible para dedicarlos a otras actividades. Por tanto tiene planes de crecer con  su negocio e incursionar en la venta de ropas de damas, caballeros y niños.Este es el crédito número 03 con Kiva, está muy emocionada y agradecida por el respaldo económico que le ofrecen para continuar con su trabajo.
Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles comprará más bebidas gasificadas de diversas marcas y sabores en mayor volumen, comprará también cervezas y otras bebidas.
texts.en:
Lilian is 28 years old, married to Jorge, and lives comfortably in a home of her own with her parents, her husband, two brothers, and her nephew.  Lilian sells soft drinks of different brands and flavors.  She also sells grilled meats in front of her house on Saturdays.   She buys her soft drinks for cash and sells them from her home to her neighbors and passers-by who are her steady customers.  She has been doing this for more than three years and her brother helps her occasionally.  He takes care of customers when she is away from home.

She had some difficulty because of the financial conditions in her home, but she was precarious, studied, and then looked for work and started her business.  She enjoys the income, having an occupation, and also being able to be in the comfort of her home and having spare time to do other things.

She plans to create a business and begin selling men’s, women’s, and children’s clothing.  This will be her third Kiva loan and she is very excited and grateful for the financial backing that will allow her to continue to work.

She will use the 2,000 PEN she is asking for to buy soft drinks of different brands and flavors in quantity.  She will also buy beer and other drinks.

loans.use: to buy slft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to waterproof his house

loans.name: Illimani De Juan Pablo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ILLIMANI DE JUAN PABLO”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cristina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de jugos y refrescos, venta de ollas, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida, venta de enseres de cocina, costura de chamarras, venta de cuadernos y libretas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cristina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de jugos y refrescos; decide emprender este negocio porque el negocio que tenía no le rendía buenos frutos y no quiere perder su capital de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de licuadora) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud.
texts.en:
Illimani de Juan Pablo Communal Bank will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members governed by a board of directors of which Cristina's the president.  The various business carried out by the bank members include food sales, juice and soft drink sales, ceramic pot sales, cosmetics sales, kitchen equipment sales, sewing ponchos, and notebook sales.

The loan they'll get will benefit micro-entrepreneurs such as Cristina.  She says it's the first time she has been a member of Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a friend who's a member.  Currently she has a business selling juice and soft drinks.  She decided to set up this business because the one she had wasn't giving her results and she doesn't want to lose her working capital.

The loan she's getting now is to increase her capital by buying a blender, which she'll get in the markets in the city of El Alto and later make and sell her products in her sales space.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her household to the extent possible, because she lives in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the attention to health.

loans.use: to buy a blender

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to market her business, including advertising and joining local organizations so as to network.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Isatu from Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of 7 and 18. In 2001, Isatu established her home products business. She began her business because she did not want to depend on her husband; instead she wants earn her own income. She works at the business ten hours per day and six days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that sometimes the bowls break.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more rubber buckets, bowls, baskets and kitchen knives. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and get a permanent business location. In the future, Isatu plans to open a shop and stop walking from door to door. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rubber buckets, bowls, baskets and kitchen knives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new equipment, fulfill orders, and to have some cash.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a fish business, selling at the market to her neighbors. She earns her other source of income from her husband who is a businessman.  

With the Kshs 12,475 she wants to take out medical insurance coverage for her family members. She decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for her business growth.

loans.use: to take out medical insurance coverage for her family members.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 38-year-old married man with six children aged 16, 14, 12, 10, 8 and  6. The elder four children attend school. Emmanuel is a coffee farmer but also works in transport (boda boda). He decided to start the transport business in order to have a daily income. His current motorbike disturbs him a lot since it keeps breaking down. He has therefore decided to borrow this loan to buy a new motorcycle. Most of his clients are traders from the trading center where he works. His main challenge is fear of theft. Emmanuel has worked hard to buy a motorbike and would not want to lose it to thieves. He is honest and hardworking

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 30 years old and married with three children, ages 5 and 10. She runs a cake business in the Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business since 2011 and sells cakes within her community. She also earns income from small-scale farming of coco and cassava. She says that her business is doing well because children like those types of food in her community. 

Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more flour, cooking oil and sugar. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to expand her business into a shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Bruno

texts.es: Don Bruno es una persona muy alegre siempre esta de muy buen humor platica que tiene 50 años de edad vive en union libre con la señora Susana desde hace varios años juntos han formado una familia con cuatro hijos los cuales todos se encuentran estudiando. Don Bruno tiene un taxi el cual utiliza para trasporte publico desde hace 10 años cuanta que inicio su actividad porque no tenia un trabajo fijo muchas veces no tenia un sueldo fijo el cual le asegura vivir sin preocupaciones economicas fue como decidio prestar sus servicios para el traporte publico, Don Bruno comento "Cuando inicie con mi actividad fue muy dificil porque inicie con un carro particular sin placas siempre tenia que cuidarme para que los policias no me agarraran y decidieran llevarse mi carro por transitar sin tener papeles en regla" sin embrago finalmente cierto dia le quitaron su auto y se lo llevaron al corralon lo recupero despues de tres meses pero tuvo que pagar una multa a las autoridades, esta situacion a Don Bruno lo obligo a formar un grupo y buscar apoyo en una empresa sus peticiones tardaron cuatro años para que les pudieran dar sus concesiones y placas de sus taxis actualmente Don Bruno tiene un taxi para su trabajo de todos los dias adicionalmete tiene otros taxis los cuales son rentados. Esta vez el señor Bruno esta solicitando el credito para comprar llatas y darle matenimiento al vehiculo el credito le ayudara para mejorar su servios ya que la dificultad que presenta Don Bruno es la competencia de taxis, Apesar de la dificultad Don Bruno piensa trabajar con muchas ganas para poder ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida le gustaria que sus hijos terminaran una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Don Bruno is a cheerful person who is always in a good mood.  He is 50 years old and has been in a common-law relationship with Sra. Susana for many years.  They have a family that includes four children, all of whom are studying.  

Don Bruno has a taxi that he offers as public transportation.  He started this business 10 years ago because he did not have a steady job.  There were many occasions in which his income was unpredictable, so he decided to provide public transportation services so that he could live without any financial worries.  Don Bruno says, “When I started my business, it was very difficult because my first vehicle did not have license plates, so I always had to be careful to not get caught by the police.  They could confiscate my car since I had no papers to show them.”   Nonetheless, his taxi was finally impounded and it took him three months to recover his vehicle.  He also had to pay a fine to the authorities.  

This situation led Don Bruno to form a group and seek support from a formal company.  The negotiations took four years before he finally received his concessions and license plates for his taxis.  Don Bruno currently has one taxi that he uses every day for his work, but he also has additional vehicles that he makes available for rent.  This time Sr. Bruno is requesting a loan so that he can buy tires and pay for the maintenance of his vehicle.  The loan will help him improve his services.  The difficulty he faces is the competition in the taxi business.  Despite these challenges, Don Bruno plans to work with great effort so that he can provide his children a better quality of life.  He would like to see them complete a professional degree.

loans.use: to buy tires and to pay for vehicle maintenance.

location.town: San Cristobal de los Baños Ixtlahuaca

loans.name: Pora

texts.en:
Pora is a married woman with eight children, one of whom still attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a food stall business, cooking flat bread and beans and selling them from home to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding into a café. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina's farming business has been doing well. She has managed to open a clothing shop from the proceeds. She has also successfully paid off her previous loan.

This is Selina's fourth loan of KES. 90,000 that will be used to restock her clothing stall and buy animal feed. She will use the increased proceeds to continue with her farming business and expand her clothing stall.

Her dream is to attain financial stability and educate her children.

loans.use: to restock her clothing stall and buy animal feed.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Alba de 52 años de edad tiene un negocio de variedades en la ciudad de Cartagena donde habita con su esposo y su hijo de 14 años de edad. Su experiencia la adquirió hace 15 años, mientras su negocio empezó hace 12. Ella inició con una tienda de barrio donde vendía artículos de la canasta familiar a la medida de las familias de su alrededor y posteriormente como estrategia fue quedándose solo con los artículos de papelería, bisutería, y variedades femeninas, además de ropa- Sus ventas las realiza de contado desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche y sus compras las realiza de contado en el mercado de la ciudad donde encuentras los productos a precios competitivos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará refrescos, ropa, artículos domésticos útiles y papelería en general. Su meta es aumentar sus ventas mediante una oferta de productos con mayor rotación que le ayuden en su propósito, para alcanzar la meta de ofrecerle estudios superiores de calidad a su hijo.
texts.en:
Alba, 52, has a variety store in the city of Cartagena where she lives with her husband and her 14 year old son. 

She has 15 years of experience and started her business 12 years ago. She started with a neighborhood store where she sold household items to families in the area and later strategically started only selling stationary, costume jewelry, miscellaneous women's items and clothes. 

She sells her products in cash from six in the morning till nine at night and she buys in cash at the city marketplace where she finds her products at competitive prices. 

Currently she is applying for a CrediKiva. It is her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo with which she will buy soda, clothes, household supplies and stationary. 

Her goal is to increase her sales by offering products with high turnover to help her reach her goal, to offer her son a high quality education.

loans.use: to buy soda, clothes, household supplies and stationary.

loans.name: Eline

texts.en: Eline is 30 years old. She is married with three children. She has sold charcoal for the past five years. Eline has requested a loan to buy more charcoal for sale. She plans to use the profits to increase her savings for a better future of her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is married and has been blessed with two children. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She cites food and school fees as her highest monthly expenses.

Kibibi has operated a food vending and fruit selling business which she sells as retail to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability of goods hence loses in her business.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase cooking fat, wheat flour, maize flour and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat, wheat flour, maize flour and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is married with four school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mishi has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past ten years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара очень трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 34 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Гулсара всегда старается, чтобы ее дети жили в достатке и получали хорошую образованию. Гулсара планирует организовать свой новый бизнес и таким образом получать доход, так как доход ее мужа Олимджона не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Гулсара обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культуры, так как ее местожительства весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки минерального удобрения, топлива. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulsara is a very hard-working and goal-oriented woman. She is 34 years old. She is married and raising four children. Gulsara always does all she can to ensure  good life conditions and   a good education for her children. Gulsara plans to launch a new business and earn an income, since the income of her husband, Olimjon, is not enough to provide for the family needs. Gulsara has completed the “Get Ahead” training course organized by the Association of Business Women and earned a certificate. She wants to launch a business growing a produce since the conditions in her region are very favorable for farming. She is applying for a loan in the amount of 3000 TJS in order to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel for launching her new business.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a widow and has two children, both of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has owned a rental house business. In addition, she cooks dumplings for resale. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan of KES 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to renovate her rental houses and purchase cement, sand and wall paints. She joined Yehu to acquire loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and wall paints to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Fatmata from Tombo in the western rural area of Freetown. She is married with five children between the ages of 8 and 17 years old.

Fatmata runs a general store business. She sells salt, butter, cigarettes, soda and biscuits. She has been running this business for nine years. She works at the business from morning to night, throughout the week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of capital to run her business.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more food commodities like salt, butter, cigarettes, soda and biscuits for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and educate her children. In the future, she plans to build a house. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: To buy more food commodities like salt, butter, cigarettes, soda and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: This is Fatmata; she is 45 years old. Fatmata is from Tombo, which is located in a rural area in western Sierra Leone. She is married with five children. She started this business to support her daily needs. Fatmata runs a business selling cola nuts. She has been running this business for three years. She works 10 hours per day and 6 days per week. Fatmata's main business challenges are the cost of transportation and the poor roads within her operation area. Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy bags of cola nuts. The extra income from this loan will allow her to buy new products such as palm oil and gari. In the future, she plans to buy a generator to light her house. Fatmata appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of cola nuts.

loans.name: Surraiya

texts.en:
Surraiya is 49 years old. She is a very energetic married woman and she has four children. She has been doing a business of hand-embroidery for the past ten years. She is passionate about her work, and wants to expand this business further. She has a good clientele and clients like her work.

Her husband is employed as a salesperson in a grocery store. He does not earn enough to support his family well. Surraiya joined her husband to support her family and for the better future of her children. Now Surrayia's embroidery patterns are very popular in her area, and she is the best earning resource in her household.

She wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of Rs 35,000, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand.

She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. She would teach embroidery skills so they can help her expand her business, and to also earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls.

loans.name: Irungu

texts.en:
Irungu was able to service his motorbike from the previous loan and made profit which he used to cater for his family's needs.

He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD after paying his previous loan timely, to enable him to buy spare parts and service his motorbike.

He hopes to buy another motorbike in the near future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and service his motorbike.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has gained eight years of experience in this field.  Her husband is a retired army constable. She is a mother of seven children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of Rs.30,000 to buy a stock of rice, flour, and sugar to meet with the increasing demand at her store without fail. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, flour, and sugar to meet with the increasing demand at her store without fail.

loans.name: Kurbonbibish

texts.ru: Курбонбибиш 54 года. Она замужем и имеет 1 ребенка. Ее муж Носир в течение многих лет занимается земледелием. Курбонбибиш хочет организовать свой бизнес земледелием и таким образом зарабатывать деньги и приносить дополнительный доход семье. Она имеет большой опыт, так как она всегда помогала мужу. Теперь она хочет не быть зависимой от мужа и иметь свой отдельный бизнес. Она как хранительница очага своего дома, планирует использовать свой доход для улучшения условия проживания. Она будет выращивать сельхоз культуры, и продавать на местном рынке. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки минерального удобрения и топлива. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется, что этот займ принесет ей радость и удачи.
texts.en: Kurbonbibish is 54 years old. She is married and has one child. Her husband Nozir has been doing land cultivation for many years. Kurbonbibish wants to start her own business doing land cultivation and make a living this way which will bring additional income for the family. She has rich experience because she always helped her husband. Now she wants to be independent from her husband and have her separate business. As a keeper of her home she plans to use the income to improve living conditions. She will grow crops and sell them on the local market. Kurbonbibish is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,000 somoni to buy mineral fertilizer and fuel. She awaits your kindness and hopes that this loan will bring her happiness and luck.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and fuel for a new business.

loans.name: Lornah

texts.en:
Lornah is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school and are still under her care. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Lornah has operated a clothes-selling business. She sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbors. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover, which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan of KES 50,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes to sell

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman with one child who attends school. Salama owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Salama has been operating a firewood-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in the same business.
 
With the KSHS 15,000, she wants to purchase three bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima, 65 years old, is married and blessed with three children who all attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Tima operates a baking, selling from home to neighbours and shop operators. She cites seasonality as a challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing another bakery in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants purchase to ingredients such as wheat flour, milk and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Lulu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Lulu from Tombo in the western rural area of Sierra Leone. She is married with two children between the ages of one and six years old. One of her children is currently attending school. In 2000, Lulu established her home product business. She began her business because she needed to get income to support the home.  Her husband is a fisherman but his income is not enough to take care of the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is breakage of the bowls.   .

Lulu requires a loan in order to purchase more rubber spoons, pots, baskets and food containers. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Lulu plans to expand her business to a shop level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber spoona, pots, baskets and food containers.

loans.name: Mayasa

texts.en:
This is Mayasa. She previously accessed a loan that she used to expand her grocery business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another KES 30,000 loan to roof her house. With the loan, she will purchase iron sheets and timber and pay labor charges. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets and timber and pay labor charges.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 66 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada  como bolsos y calzado y también genera ingresos mediante el arriendo de apartamentos. Su experiencia comercial data desde el año 2007, siguiendo el ejemplo de su madre, que también se desempeño como comerciante. Hoy Carmen sus ventas las realiza de contado y también maneja una cartera de cuentas por cobrar, que recupera semanalmente, en un horario de trabajo que inicia desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Sus compras las hace en la ciudad de Bucaramanga, lugar de Colombia, donde la calidad de los productos marroquineros y de calzado son inigualables. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, sexto financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará bolsos y calzado que tiene encargados,  a propósito del día de las madres, fecha en a cual las familias sorprenden con regalos a su progenitora o a la que la  representa. Esto es justamente lo que hace que su inversión en esta temporada sea exitosa.
texts.en: Carmen is 66 years old. She sells varied merchandise such as bags and shoes. She also generates income through renting apartments. Her business experiences dates from the year 2007. She followed her mother's example. She was also a merchant. Today Carmen makes her sales up front and she also sells on credit that she collects weekly. Her work schedule is from 8 in the morning until 8 at night. She does her purchasing in the city of Bucaramanga, Colombia, where the quality of leather goods and shoes are unequaled. Right now, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the sixth she has taken out with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy bags and shoes that have been ordered from her for Mother's Day, when families surprised their progenitor with gifts. This is why she is making her investment at this time, to be successful.

loans.use: to buy bags and shoes.

loans.name: Wangninan 2 Group

texts.fr: WANGNINAN 2 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des cohabitantes. La représentante du groupe, Élisabeth (qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un certain Karim. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les diverses charges familiales sont assumées par le couple. Élisabeth n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Elisabeth vend du poisson fumé depuis une dizaine d'années ; ce qui lui permet d'assurer les besoins de ses enfants. Élisabeth s’approvisionne dans des poissonneries au Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurs. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Élisabeth, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINAN 2, désire obtenir un sixième financement auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The WANGNINAN 2 group is made up of three women who live together.   The group's representative, Élisabeth, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  She is 39 years old and married to a man named Karim.  They have four children, some of whom go to school.  All four children are their dependents.  The couple takes care of the various family expenses.

Élisabeth did not go to school.  She has been selling smoked fish for about ten years, an activity which allows her to meet her children's needs.  She stocks up in fish stores in Benin.

Élisabeth has taken loans from ALIDé in the past, and has duly repaid them. 

In order to boost her business and to meet the demand from her customers, Élisabeth is requesting a sixth loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the WANGNINAN 2 group.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en: Anwar, 25 years old, is from Hodeida, Yemen. He’s a single man. He has been operating a phone accessories business for four years. He is a hardworking man who looks for earning an income to improve his living conditions. This is his first business. He does not have help from anyone else. He runs his business by himself. His plan is to expand his business. He’s asking for a youth loan of 100,000 YER to buy phone accessories for his business. He feels this loan will help him to increase sales as well as his income.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 35 años de edad, es una mujer casada que habita con su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos en las edades de 9 a 19 años al sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Ella tiene 23 años de experiencia en la fabricación de calzado, pues su familia, por parte de su cónyuge, se dedica a esta actividad y comercializan en almacenes de cadenas en el departamento del Atlántico y en el municipio de Maicao en el departamento de la Guajira, también al norte de Colombia. Maria necesita tener un surtido variado y moderno, para impactar nuevos clientes, pero su capital de trabajo es su mayor desafío, porque nos es suficiente para su propósito. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas, como suelas, marquillas y adornos, en mayor volumen, para lograr mejores precios y aumentar su producción. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y de contado y sus principales clientes son almacenes, misceláneas en general. Su credikiva planea ser exitoso, porque le permitirá acceder a nuevos clientes y lograr más ingresos en la temporada de Mayo, en la cual se celebra el día,   para cumplir poco a poco su sueño de prosperidad familiar que no es otra cosa que el bienestar de sus hijos,  especialmente en el tema de educación superior de calidad.
texts.en:
Maria, 35 years old, is a married woman who lives with her husband and four children, between the ages of 9 and 19 years old, in the south of Barranquilla. She has 23 years experience in shoe production, and her family, on the part of her husband, makes a living from this work. They sell in chain stores in the Atlantic department and in the municipality of Maicao in the Guajira department, as well as northern Colombia.

Maria needs to have varied and modern merchandise to make an impact on her customers, but her money from work is her biggest challenge. This is because it is not enough for their purpose. This is the reason why she is going to Kiva loans, the first financing that she is getting from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and through which she will buy raw materials, like soles, tags, and decorations in bulk to get the best prices and increase her production. She makes her sales on loan and with cash, and her main customers are generally warehouses and corner shops.  

She plans her Kiva loan to be successful because it will allow her to access new customers and earn more income in the season of May, in which the day is celebrated to be able to reach her dream of family prosperity day by day. This nothing more than for the well-being of her children, especially on the subject of higher quality education.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, like soles, tags, and decorations in bulk.

loans.name: Kathlyn

texts.es: Kathlyn de 23 años de edad, es una confeccionista que habita en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, lugar donde tiene su pequeño taller de confecciones, el cual inició desde el año 2000, después de aprender de su madre el oficio de preparar ensamblar y acabar ropa para damas. Con esta actividad ha logrado obtener ingresos para apoyar los gastos de su hogar. Los principales productos de su oferta son las blusas, los vestidos, pantalones, piyamas, que ofrece a su clientela de vecinos del sector, los que poco a poco les han referido a otros y así ha logrado aumentar su cobertura. En la actualidad está aplicado a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual comprará telas, hilos, botones cierres y otros insumos de confecciones, con los cuales planea diseñar nuevos modelos de ropa y aumentar su oferta, para vender mas. Su meta más adelante es tener su propia casa y por eso trabaja diariamente mediante ventas a crédito y de contado, con el fin de generar mayores ingresos y lograr su sueño de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Kathlyn, 23 years old, is a seamstress who lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias. Here, she has a small sewing studio, which she began working at in 2000 after her mother taught her how to construct, assemble, and finish clothing for women. With this work, Kathlyn has been able to earn income to pay household expenses. The main products she offers are blouses, dresses, pants, and pajamas. She sells these items to neighbors living in the area. These customers have gradually been referring others to her, which has increased her business.

Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, which is her first financing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With the loan, she will buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, and other sewing supplies. With these supplies, Kathlyn plans to design new pieces of clothing and increase her inventory so she can sell more. Her primary goal is to have her own house. For this reason, she works every day making sales via both cash and credit. She hopes to generate more income and achieve her dreams of success.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, and other sewing supplies

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a resident of Mbarara municipality. He is 39 years old and married with seven children of his own and four other children left by his uncle who died in a motor accident four years ago. All his children and dependents are in school. He dropped out of school after primary seven due to a lack of school fees and started to work as a porter at nearby building sites. With the little savings he accumulated, he started a small retail shop for survival. This has enabled him to look after his family as well as pay school fees for the children. The business is running with inadequate capital so he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Uganda shillings to increase his capital. This will help him to get more income to pay school fees as well as help him meet other costs of living.

loans.use: To buy items for his retail shop

loans.name: Rosario Yulieth

texts.es: Yulieth es una joven estudiante tiene 22 años estudia en la universidad TELESUP electrónica industrial le falta un año y medio para que termine su carrera profesional. En sus tiempos libres se dedicada a hacer instalaciones domiciliaras. El préstamo lo usara en la compra de herramienta y equipos de estudio como: multimetro, taladro para placas soldador y componentes electrónicos. Su meta en el futuro es terminar su carrera profesional y trabajar en una gran empresa o en minas. Yulieth agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo y de la misma manera a sus padres que le brindan su apoyo en alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en: Yulieth is a young, 22 year old student. She studies industrial electrics at TELESUP university. She has a year and a half to go to finish her major. In her free time, she works doing house installations. She will use the loan to buy tools and study equipment such as: a multimeter,  a drill for welding plates and electrical components. Her goal for the future is to finish her major and work at a great business or in mining. Yulieth is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan and also to her parents that have given her their support to reach her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase tools and study equipment.

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en: Hidaya is requesting another loan of KES 50,000 to purchase fishing net for her business. The first loan she used to purchase bales of clothes which gave her a good income that enabled her to open another business selling fish as an additional source of income. She is grateful for the first loan and that is why she decided to apply for another one.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net for her business

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Ms Shabana is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been providing a service packing and selling ‘nimko’ for about six years. She purchases ‘nimko’ from the local market and after doing packing with the help of her machine, she sells it to the people of her community. She makes packets in various sizes according to the demands of her customers and makes enough to contribute in the family income. Her husband is a laborer whose income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members alone. So she decided to initiate her own business at her home with support of Kashf foundation six years ago. Currently she applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase stock of nimko and wrapping sheets. In this way, she will be able to increase her sales. She dreams of providing a good standard of living and quality education to her six children.

loans.use: to purchase stock of nimko and wrapping sheets.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, age 57, is a married woman with five kids. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a kiosk business selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Fatuma dreams of establishing a wholesale shop business in the future. 

With the loan of Kes 20,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and beans

loans.name: Ana Griselda

texts.es: Ana de 30 años vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con  su cónyuge y su hijo de 2 meses de nacido.  Su actividad como comerciante realizada desde hace 13 años, como empleada de almacenes, le sirvió para construir lo que hoy es su pequeño negocio, donde ofrece diversas mercancías como artículos de papelería, accesorios femeninos, artículos de aseo entre otros productos.   En la actualidad sus ventas las realiza de contado y también ofrece créditos  a sus mejores clientes, que son sus vecinos y referidos de otros sectores. Su meta mas adelante es tener sucursales y adquirir una vivienda propia por eso sus esfuerzos se enfocan en hacer crecer su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, mediante el cual comprará mercancías que presentan una muy alta rotación y su compra se convierte en un desafío pues en la mediada en que crece su clientela, el efectivo no es suficiente para responder a la demanda del mercado . Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva mediante el cual comprará sandalias, ropa para bebe papel de regalo y jabones., que ofrecerá directamente en su local extendiendo su horario desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche como usualmente lo hace, para generar mas ingresos y beneficiar a su familia.
texts.en: Ana is 30 years old. She lives in the city of Barranquilla with her spouse and her 2 month old son. She started her activity as a merchant 13 years ago as a store employee. That helped her build what is her small business today, where she offers different merchandise such as paper products, women's accessories, hygiene items and more. Right now, she sells up front and also on credit to her best customers, who are her neighbors and people referred from other areas. Her goal for the future is to have branches and acquire her own home. that is why she focuses her efforts on making her business grow. Right now, she is applying for a Kiva loan. With it, she will buy merchandise that is in high rotation and is challenging to buy as her clientele grows. Her cash isn't enough to respond to the market demand. That is why she is turning to a Kiva loan to buy sandals, baby clothes, gift wrap and soap. This will affect her locale directly and she will expend her schedule fro 9 a.m. until 9 p.m. to generate more income and benefit her family.

loans.use: to buy sandals, baby clothing, gift wrap and soap.

loans.name: Phanem Group

texts.en:
“To be a responsible eldest daughter-in-law is a pride and a challenging task,” says Hatneineng. She is pictured with her hand raised and she is the featured borrower for the "Phanem" Group. After the death of her brother-in-law, she and her husband looked after the four kids her brother-in-law had left behind. She and her husband feed eight kids, which is inclusive of their kids and the bereaved brother-in-law's kids. She also says surviving without a regular income is the toughest part because her husband is a lorry driver. In case of bandh in the state or a blockade on the two National Highways, the family income depreciates. To supplement the family income, she started a small Pan-Corner in the town market, which is located near the Town Bus stand.

At the beginning of her business, she sold only paan and cigarettes as she didn't have sufficient capital to start a big business.  Her prudent quality shows because after a year, she could refill her paan corner with cosmetic products and used clothes. She says her shop location gives more advantages than the rest of the shop. She gets more customers from bus passengers who are departing and arriving in the town. She now enhanced the family income by triple and shares her husband's burden.
 
With the loan, she will buy more stock for the shop including summer used clothes like kurtees, medi-pants, T-shirts, shorts etc. Her aspiration is to buy a mini-van and use it for hiring purposes. Her husband earns by driving someone else's vehicle, which is tiring and high risk because if there is unfortunate accidental damage, the driver has to pay. She says after she joined the Phanem Group, she grew in different manners of life. She gained trust from other business partners and opened more doors for income-generating activities. Hatneineng and her husband also support her sister-in-law in pursuing her BSc Nursing degree. She will complete her course soon. Her accomplishments are uncountable says Hatneineng. She and her husband will work side-by-side to achieve what they dream of and will surely be successful.

The rest of the group members are engaged in a ginger farm, a piggery, a garment-selling business etc. All the group members follow a group savings and a meeting is conducted on the second Sunday of every month. She says she is honored to be in the Phanem Group and thanked WSDS and Kiva for the support and love shown to the group. She considers it a personal blessing and prays to God for the growth of both WSDS and Kiva.

loans.use: To refill her stocks with more cosmetic products and summer used clothes.

loans.name: Assumpta

texts.en:
Assumpta, 40 years old, is a married woman and has been blessed with five kids. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for her kids.

For the past four years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Assumpta dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 15,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour and beans

loans.name: Shehla

texts.en: Ms. Shehla is a 29-year-old unmarried lady. She has expertise in embroidery and is using her skills for the provision of excellent services to her customers. She is doing embroidery to generate income to meet the household expenses. Her father and brother work for daily wages. Shehla’s income is a contribution to meet household expenses. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today, she is proud of being famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to acquire a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. She is in her first loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and wants to purchase a machine and cloth so she requested a loan of PKR 25,000.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Lina Marcela

texts.es:
Lina de 28 años, tiene dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, a los cuales se ha dedicado desde que nacieron, razón por la cual decidió laborar desde su casa, con el fin colaborarle a su cónyuge con los gastos del hogar y brindarles a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida. Se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo, el cual no demanda mucho tiempo y le permite estar pendiente de los deberes del hogar. Lina se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora, que se esfuerza por sacar adelante su hogar. 

Su mayor sueño es mejorar su condición económica y ofrecerles a sus dos hijos la oportunidad de crecer en un ambiente sin carencias económicas. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza, aseo personal y una vitrina, con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Lina is 28 years old and has two children who are 5 and 2. She has been dedicated to her children since the day they were born, which is the reason she decided to work from home so she can help her husband with household expenses and provide them with better living conditions. She makes a living sell products via catalog, which does not take up too much time and allows her to take care of household chores. Lina is known as a fighter who works hard to make headway for her family. Her biggest dream is to improve her financial situation and offer her two children the opportunity to grow up in an environment free of economic hardships. She is requesting the loan to purchase beauty and personal hygiene products as well as a display case, with the goal of increasing her income and improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase beauty and personal hygiene products as well as a display case.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 46 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 4 y 8 años. Ella recuerda aun aquel 20 de Junio del año 2006, fecha en la que dio inicio a su negocio de venta de comidas, cuando siguió el consejo de un familiar, quien le proporción la idea de generar ingresos mediante esta actividad. Hoy su negocio ha crecido y su clientela está ubicada alrededor de su vivienda, donde tiene su pequeño restaurante, mientras sus compras las realiza  de contado en el mercado público. Su propósito es ampliar su negocio y para ello requiere capital de trabajo, que le permita aumentar su producción y acceder a nuevos clientes. Pues tiene el sueño de prosperidad, de entregar a sus hijos la mejor educación que le sea posible, y por eso con su esposo se esmeran diariamente para lograrlo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas e insumos, como víveres y refresco, con los que planea aumentar su  producción y generar más ingresos, para cumplir sus sueños familiares.
texts.en: Carmen, who is 46 years old, lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband and their two children, ages 4 and 8. She still remembers that 20th of June in the year 2006, the date on which she began her business of selling food, when she followed the advice of a relative, who gave her the idea of generating income through this activity. Today, her business has grown, and her customers are located around her house, where she has her little restaurant, while she makes her purchases for cash in the public market. Her goal is to expand her business, and for that she needs working capital, which will allow her to increase her production and obtain new customers. Thus she has the dream of prosperity, of giving her children the best education that is possible for her, and for this reason she and her husband strive every day to achieve it. Now she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Mario Santo Domingo foundation, through which she will buy basic ingredients and supplies, such as groceries and soft drinks, with which she plans to increase her production and generate more income, to fulfill her family dreams.

loans.use: to buy basic ingredients and supplies, such as groceries and soft drinks.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina tiene 27 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de productos amway a familiares, amigos y conocidos, este negocio surgió gracias a la pasión y a la habilidad que Cristina tiene para las ventas. Actualmente, trabaja sola y con su carisma y amabilidad ha logrado conseguir y fidelizar un gran número de clientes. 
Con el propósito de continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza y aseo personal, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y contribuir con los gastos en su hogar y la educación de su hijo de 4 años de edad.
texts.en: Cristina is 27 years old and makes a living selling Amway products to family members, friends and acquaintances. This business grew thanks to Cristina's passion and ability for sales. She currently works alone, and with her charisma and friendlies has been able to obtain and retain a large number of customers. With the goal to continue growing her business, she is requesting the loan to purchase beauty and personal hygiene products. This will allow her to increase her income and help out with household expenses and the education of her 4-year-old son.

loans.use: to purchase beauty and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to restart her business selling fruits and vegetables and to build two rooms and a kitchen.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina, de 35 años de edad , tiene 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 3 de ellos, en la casa que heredó de su padres hace algunos años. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de  desayunos de manera ambulante,  su lugar de ventas esta ubicada al frente de una universidad privada que esta cerca a su hogar, recibe la ayuda de una de sus hijas que la apoya en la atención, atiende su negocio por las mañanas y las épocas de mayor ventas es mientras hay temporada de clases, en vacaciones suele bajar y es en ahí que busca otras oportunidades como el tejido que siempre realiza  de manera permanente en las tardes, Sabina ha visto la rentabilidad de sus ingresos mediante los negocios que realiza es por eso que ha decidido mejorar su  negocio.Este es el crédito número 4 con Kiva, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe, así mismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Sabina,  invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de maca e ingredientes al por mayor para seguir  vendiendo los desayunos.
texts.en: Sabina, who is 36 years old, has 5 children, but she lives with only 3 of them in the house that she inherited from her parents some years ago. For 8 years she has sold breakfasts as a street vendor. Her sales spot is located in front of a private university which is close to her home. She receives help from one of her daughters, who helps her with service. She tends her business in the mornings, and the times for the best sales are while there is a class session. During vacations, it usually goes down, and this is when she looks for other opportunities such as knitting, which she always does on a permanent basis in the afternoons. Sabina has seen the earning power of her income through the businesses that she has, and this is why she has decided to improve her business. This is her fourth loan with Kiva, and so she is grateful for the financial support that she receives, and she also promises to be punctual in making her payments. Sabina will invest the 2000 PEN in the purchase of maca (a local root vegetable) and wholesale ingredients to continue selling breakfasts.

loans.use: to buy maca and other wholesale ingredients.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es: Amparo es una mujer de 36 años de edad que habita en la ciudad de Cartagena con sus pequeños hijo de 3 meses y 15 años de edad. Ella para lograr el sustento de su hogar tiene una microempresa de preparación de almuerzos y desayunos desde el año 2009,. Su negocio inició cuando decidida a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia empezó vendiendo en pequeñas proporciones y fue agregando mayor cantidad, hasta lograr no solo vende almuerzos sino también complementar con frituras refrescos naturales, café etc.  para que sus clientela pudiera desayunar y satisfacer esta necesidad bien temprano antes de irse a trabajar. Sus ventas las realiza de contado desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde mientras sus compras las hace el  mercado público de la ciudad, para lograr acceso a precios competitivos en su materia prima. Su meta es continuar su crecimiento y por eso recurre a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres y frituras, para aumentar su producción e incrementar así mismo sus ventas. Su sueño de prosperidad es lograr tener una casa propia y por eso todos los días se esmera trabajando para contar con ella en un futuro.
texts.en:
Amparo, 36, lives in the city of Cartagena with her young children, ages 3 months and 15.  To support her household she has had a small business making breakfast and lunch since 2009.

She started her business when she decided to improve her family's quality of life.  She began selling in small proportions and kept adding more, until she sold not only lunches but also fried food, natural beverages, coffee, etc. so her customers could eat breakfast and satisfy that necessity very early before going to work.

She makes her sales in cash from 6 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon.  She makes her purchases in the city's public market so she can get competitive prices on her ingredients.

Her goal is to continue her growth, which is why she's requesting a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it she'll buy provisions and fried food to increase her products as well as her sales.

Her dream for prosperity is to manage to have her own house, which is why she works hard every day to have one in the future.

loans.use: to buy provisions and fried food

loans.name: Marta Ledy

texts.es:
Marta de 50 años de edad,  es dueña desde hace un año de una pequeña tienda, la cual logró montar con sacrificio y constancia. Debido a sus limitaciones de salud, al no poder realizar actividades de alto esfuerzo, decidió dedicarse a las ventas en su negocio. 
Con la esperanza de mejorar su condición económica y su nivel de ventas,  se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de productos de la canasta familiar. 
Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos, ampliando su negocio y mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marta is 50 years old. For the last year, she has been the owner of a small shop that she managed to set up with sacrifice and perseverance. Since she can't undertake physically demanding activities due to health limitations, she decided to earn her living in the retail business. 

In hopes of improving her economic conditions and her sales, she is requesting a loan to buy everyday staples. 

She dreams of improving her income, expanding her business and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase everyday staples.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma is a permanent resident of  Mitooma district. He is married with six children and three other dependents from his sister. Juma barely makes enough just to feed the children. He grew up without parents since both died when he was young, making his life difficult. Being pushed by the need to survive, he started coffee farming on a small scale on the land he inherited from his  parents. Because he was hard working, he used his little savings to buy more land that enabled him to grow more coffee. This business has grown, giving him an opportunity to support his family and dependents. He is requesting a loan of 3000000 UGX to complete his simple house to accommodate his family.

loans.use: To complete construction of his house

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 45-year-old married woman who works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for about 25 years and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Parveen was not earning, her family went through a severe financial crisis. That compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. She stitches the clothes of the latest designs and styles. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She has applied for a loan of  25000 PKR to purchase more spools of threads, packs of buttons and laces. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing customer demand consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Parveen hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a quality education to her children for their bright and prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, packs of buttons and laces.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Ms Nasreen is a 39-year-old married woman who is living with her husband and five children in Punjab, Pakistan. The man shown in the photo is Nasreen’s husband who has been providing a service of filling water in gallons from the canal and supplying it to the people of their community for a period of about three years. To help continue the operations, she has requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase another cart and drums in various sizes to fill with water. In this way, her husband will be able to serve more customers efficiently. Nasreen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase another cart and drums in various sizes for water

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 36 years old, is from Nakuru and is married with two children who are in school. He has been in the farming business for the past four years.

He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy fertilizer and pay for labor. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our staff.

He hopes to buy a plot in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Ms Nusrat is a 36-year-old vigorous lady. She has been in business selling thread for many years. She purchases threads in large quantity and after reeling, supplies them to shops and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more thread and reels in large quantity so that she can increase production and create a means of increasing revenues to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her second loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more thread and reels in large quantity.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 37 years old and from Naivasha. He is married and has two children who are in school.

He has a taxi business which he has operated for the last five years. He has applied for his sixth loan from KADET LTD after paying his previous loan successfully. HIs new load would enable him to pay insurance for his taxi.

He hopes to buy another taxi in the near future.

loans.use: To pay insurance for his taxi.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is 50 years old and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for 15 years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Rukhsana was not earning, her family went through a severe financial crisis. That compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family and Rukhsana felt obligated to improve her family’s living standards and started working from home. She is a brave woman and hard work helped her establish a good clientele but she was having difficulty fulfilling large orders. That’s when her neighbor advised her to borrow from Kashf. She has requested a loan of 30000 PKR which will be used to purchase a new stitching machine, some thread and stitching material.

loans.use: To purchase a new stitching machine, some thread and stitching material.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 54-year-old vigorous lady who, for the past 15 years, has been running a clothing business. Irshad buys clothes of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the big market of Peshawar at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community at a reasonable profit. 

After the death of her husband, she has been playing a very important role in supporting her family. She has been working in association with Kashf for the past four years. At present, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 PKR which will allow her to purchase a greater selection of clothes in a larger variety of colors, taking into account the tastes and choices of her customers.

Irshad has been working with Kashf for last four years and her repayment record is remarkable. She wants to have her own house in the community where she lives.

loans.use: To purchase a greater selection of clothes in a larger variety of colors

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Ms Shamim is a 54-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in the corner of her house. She has five years of experience in this field. Her husband and son also assist her by purchasing goods from the market, as her husband has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with health and good quality food and clothing. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of Rs.30,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She expects an increase in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her second loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Jingvalpa Group

texts.en:
"Indeed, Hoichong deserves to be the secretary of the Jingvalpa group” says Hoichong’s husband. Hoichong lives an exemplary life for other women folks in the village. Her right arm is paralyzed but she is capable of performing every household chore with only the help of her left arm. She also generates income for the family by weaving and raising pigs. She is the secretary of Jingvalpa Group and she is the featured borrower of the group. She is pictured with her hand raised. Hoichong still looks young and strong after raising eight children.
 
Hoichong weaves with the help of the loom, using only her one arm. She also raises pigs. She can weave all the different patterns and the latest designs. Her woven products are mostly traditional women's wrap around skirts and men's shawls, which are considered to be the most expensive ones. She sells her woven products in her village and nearby villages. Since her village is about 3 1/2 kms away from the town market, she goes there only on market day, which is every Friday. On the other days, she raises pigs and finds feed for the pigs in the nearby fields. She says her pigs are all healthy and they are growing fast. She hopes to make a good sale when they are fully grown. She paid back her previous loan on time and managed to have a group savings with the other group members. 

With the Kiva loan, she will purchase two more piglets and more yarn for the weaving business.  She shares that facilities for physically different persons were applied for by her husband so that she could avail government schemes to promote herself in generating an income for the family. The required proceedings were followed but it took longer than expected. By that time, she had joined Jingvalpa Group and now she is able to make an income for the family, which makes her believe in herself more. She says her confidence grows more with the family and society too. The family burden is now shared financially by her. She thanks WSDS and Kiva for all the support and assistance provided to them. She says, "Thank you so much".
The rest of the group members are engaged in a piggery, a vegetable-selling business, a rice-selling business, and weaving.

loans.use: To purchase more yarn to weave and two more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Magaly Esther

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Magaly, quien con su anterior credikiva logró comprar una vitrina y surtió el negocio con ropa y útiles escolares, que tuvieron una buena demanda en su mercado objetivo.  Ella está muy satisfecha, porque su imagen mejoró y también porque en su oferta exhibió una mayor variedad de artículos que impactaron positivamente sus ventas. Sus ingresos se han incrementado y gracias a ello mejoró su calidad de vida. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará jeans, blusas deportivas, ajustándose a la demanda de la temporada venidera. Ella planea tener mucho éxito con esta inversión, porque la hace en una muy buena época del año y ahora cuenta con activos que le permiten exhibir elegantemente lo que ofrece, impulsando así su venta. Magaly envía un mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva  que dice textualmente lo siguiente:” Gracias por el apoyo y espero que nos sigan apoyando. “
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Magaly, who was able to use her previous Kiva loan to buy a display case and stock her business with clothing and school supplies, as there was quite a bit of demand for them in her target market. She is very satisfied, because her image improved and also because she was able to display a greater variety of items which positively affected her sales. Her income has increased and thanks to that, she has improved her quality of life. 

Currently, Magaly is applying for a new Kiva loan that she will use to buy jeans and sporty tops, adapting to the coming season. She is planning to have a lot of success with this investment because she is making it at a very good time of the year and now she has fixtures that allow her to display her merchandise elegantly, which drives sales. 

Magaly sends a message to her Kiva lenders that says this: "Thank you for the support, and I hope that you continue supporting us."

loans.use: to buy jeans and sporty tops

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Ms  Shehnaz is 42 years old and married.  She has been running a business of animal sales and purchases for many years.
