She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up and then she sells them in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she requested a loan of Rs.40,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last ten years with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Naseem's husband. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She is the mother of five children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 25000 to buy rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wants to improve her business so that she can contribute more to improving her living standard.

loans.use: To buy rice and flour from the market at lower rates

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat is a 35-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of milk sales for the past year. She has many cows with milk. She sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she prepares from the milk. Her husband is a private employee but the income of her husband is not sufficient to meet all the expenses of the family members alone. She is the mother of two children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. In order to increase her sales she requested a loan of PKR 25000 to purchase one more cow with milk. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of providing a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow with milk.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms. Razia has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over 10 years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required materials. Today she is proud to be famous in her community as being the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads.

Three years ago, when Razia borrowed from Kashf for the first time, it helped her to expand her business. Now she has requested another loan worth of  40,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to purchase in bulk the latest beads, threads, sequins, and pearls. She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Razia has taken up.

loans.use: To purchase latest beads, threads, sequins, and pearls.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Ms. Bushra is a 49-year-old lady and enjoys doing work of hand embroidery. She started doing this work with her daughters. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory. Due to an increase in demand of her embroidery designs, she is indulging other women in her business. She has two daughters and one son. She is separated from her husband. She is motivated to provide her family basic necessities of life, including food, clothes, and education. 

In order to meet her growing demand of embroidery, Bushra needs to employ some more women. Now she requested a loan of 15,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) from Kashf foundation. In this way she can manage to buy more frames, needles, and threads of different colors, which will help in generating more income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy more frames, needles, and threads of different colors.

loans.name: Mahucolo Group

texts.fr: MAHUCOLO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des belles sœurs et des coépouses. La représentante du groupe du nom de Marie 2 (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 33 ans. Marie 2 est mariée à un certain Henri. Marie 2 a fréquenté l’école jusqu'au niveau secondaire. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Marie 2 assure ensemble avec son mari, les charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Marie 2 vend de la nourriture (riz, haricot) à son domicile. Marie 2 s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profits, Marie 2 sollicite, ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe MAHUCOLO, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The MAHUCOLO group consists of three members who are sisters-in-law and co-wives.  The group's representative, Marie 2, is raising her hand in the photo.  She is 33 years old and married to a man named Henri.

Marie 2 has attended school up to the secondary level.  She and her husband have four children, some of whom are in school.  All four are their dependents.  Marie 2 and her husband jointly take care of the household's expenses.

In order to cover her various expenses, Marie 2 sells food products (rice, beans) from home.  She stocks up at a market in Benin.

Eager to better meet the expectations of an increasing number of customers, and also to make more profits, Marie 2 is requesting a third loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the MAHUCOLO group.  The previous two loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Mehboob

texts.en:
Ms Mehboob is a 45-year-old married woman doing a business of selling milk for the past 15 years. She has one buffalo. She sells 8 Kilograms of milk daily to many of her neighbors. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She has four children, of whom one is school-going. She is very motivated to provide her children a beautiful life with good food and clothing.

Mehboob has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. Her husband is working as a security guard and her son as a mason. Mehboob is also doing this business because her husband and son's incomes are not enough to meet the household expenses. This is her second year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of it. Now she has requested for a loan of 35,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) for purchasing a new buffalo. She hopes to increase her production capacity, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase a new buffalo.

loans.name: Rukhsar

texts.en:
Ms Rukhsar is a 22-year-old lady. She is married and has one kid. She is very talented and excels in her work of cloth stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community, so she decided to initiate her own business in her home with the support of Kashf Foundation. Her Husband's income is nominal and not enough to cover the family expenditures.

Rukhsar wants to support her family by using her talent, so she requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR). She intends to use this loan amount to buy spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue so she may able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: To buy spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Ms Anwar is a vigorous 46-year-old lady. She has been doing embroidery work with her son for many years. She is doing this work for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 35,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) from Kashf Foundation again. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishment to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate healthier source of income.

Anwar is in her second loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support. She has a dream to provide all necessary needs for her children.

loans.use: To buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embelishment.

loans.name: Gulfareen

texts.en:
Ms. Gulfareen is a 44-year-old married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has received a lot of appreciation from her community. She accepted the fact that if her husband alone works for the family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their house and the educational needs of their only child. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gulfareen has now requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to purchase more spools of thread, along with packs of buttons, zippers, and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demands of her customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

Gulfareen hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her child through all her hard work.

loans.use: To purchase more spools of thread, along with packs of buttons, zippers, and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Philys

texts.en:
Philis is a farmer from Olkalau. She benefited from a previous loan by being able to harvest in good time.

She has applied for her fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy a cow after paying her previous loan on time.

She hopes to enlarge her farming and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a farmer from Olkalau. She was able to buy dairy cow with her previous loan. She has applied for her fifth loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy fertilizer and dairy feed after paying her previous loan on time.

She hopes to educate her children and buy more dairy cows in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and dairy feeds.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has a motorbike and a shop business where he sells handbags and sandals, among other items. He managed to buy stock for his shop from a previous loan.

He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him open a grocery shop after paying his previous loans successfully.

He hopes to open a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to buy stock of goods like basins, handbags, and more sandals for sale.

loans.name: Finangnon Group

texts.fr: FINANGNON est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des cohabitantes. La représentante du groupe du nom de Pascaline (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 33 ans. Pascaline est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de François. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Pascaline vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pascaline a un peu fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Pascaline vend des sous-vêtements (soutiens gorges). Pascaline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profits, Pascaline sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FINANGNON, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The FINANGNON group consists of three women who live in the same house.  The group's representative, named Pascaline, is raising her hand in the photo.  She is 33 years old and married to a driver named François.  Pascaline and François have three children, who all go to school.  In addition to their own children,  they also have another child in their care.

Pascaline lives with her husband and children.  The couple jointly takes care of the household expenses.

Pascaline attended school for a short period of time.  In order to cover her various expenses, she sells undergarments (bras).  She buys her merchandise at a market located in Benin.

In order to better meet the expectations of an increasing number of customers, and also to make more profits, Pascaline is requesting a first loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the FINANGNON group.

loans.use: to buy undergarments (bras).

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Gifty is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling onions in Ay/New Town (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for one year six months. Gifty is married and has one child. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Gifty will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of onions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gifty plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of onions

loans.name: Zuid

texts.en: Zuid is a 29-year-old married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a hotel where she cooks and serves food. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a populated area. She describes her biggest business challenge as being not enough space. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more wheat flour, cooking oil and other items for cooking in the hotel and also to expand size of the hotel. Her business goal is to open a proper restaurant within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more wheat flour, cooking oil and other items for cooking in the hotel and also expand size of the hotel.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is still raising pigs. She now earns a monthly income of KES.14,000 which she uses to support her family. Jane is applying for her second loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy pig feed.
With the anticipated profits from the business she will buy more pigs. She hopes to be the leading pig supplier in Thika and to build rental houses in the future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Toto

texts.en:
Toto is 37 years old, married, and has three children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past three years, she has operated a green grocery. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality of products hence a reduction in sales.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a farmer from Ndunyu Njeru. She has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy fertilizer and seeds. She paid her previous loans on time.
She hopes to expand her farming business to a larger scale in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip is a 48-year-old man with 4 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail store where he sells flour, sugar, cooking oil and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a populated area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of stock. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil and other items. His business goal is to own a wholesale space within 5 years. This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loans were paid back successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is still practicing mixed-crop farming. His grocery business is also doing well. He is grateful to KADET and Kiva for the financial assistance they extended to him. His monthly earning has now increased to KES 10,200. He is applying for his second loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling palm oil in Ay/New Town (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 5 years. Ekua is married and has 4 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Ekua wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels of palm fruit, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of palm oil. In the long term, Ekua plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of the rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of palm fruit, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of palm oil.

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en: Even though Hanna grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Hanna is an entrepreneur. She sells onions and sandals in Ay/New Town (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 3 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their 3 children. Hanna has identified that there are growing demands among consumers’ for her product. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more onions and sandals to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hanna wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more onions and sandals.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is still operating his butchery business. The business is doing well and he is thankful to KADET LTD and Kiva for lending him money which has enabled him to improve his business.
He is now requesting another business loan to purchase more goats for slaughtering. He hopes to see his family happy and settled.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to slaughter.

loans.name: Martha Nelly

texts.es: Martha a sus 51 años es una emprendedora quien conciente de la necesidad de sacar a sus dos hijos adelante, decidió iniciar desde hace cinco años en la acera de su casa su propio negocio, dedicado a la elaboración y venta de comidas rápidas y fritos, trabajando todos los días de seis de la mañana a ocho de la noche. Gracias a este negocio puede generar los ingresos para el sustento de su hogar. Con el propósito de garantizarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro, Martha se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de un carro de comidas rápidas e insumos para preparar sus ventas, mejorando la calidad en el servicio y aumentando sus ingresos con el fin de cumplir sus sueños y brindarle un mejor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Martha, 51, is an entrepreneur who decided, five years ago, to set up her own business out in front of her house in order to provide for her two children.  She sells fast fried foods and works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.   Her business generates enough income to support her household.

In order to guarantee a better future for her children, Martha is requesting a new loan to buy a fast food cart and supplies to enhance sales, quality and service.  This is to increase her income so she can meet her goals and give her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy a fast food cart.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Doña Concepcion de 55 años de edad,vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su nieto de 8 años de edad, Ella posee una tienda donde vende pan, refrescos, aceites, verduras, frutas, golosinas y también de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación. Doña Concepcion solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar y a su familia.
texts.en:
Concepción, 55, lives in her own house with her two children and 8-year-old grandson.  She runs a store out of her house where she sells bread, soft drinks, oils, vegetables, fruit, sweets and essential items such as soap and shampoo.  

Concepción is requesting a loan to stock more merchandise in her store so she can provide better customer service and increase sales.  This is her priority for enabling her family to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy sugar, beans, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa María de 43 años  de edad, laboró por varios años en una empresa del sector privado, pero debido al nacimiento de sus tres hijos, se vio en la necesidad de renunciar, para dedicarles tiempo. Razón que la motivó a abrir su propio negocio desde su casa y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos  del hogar. Hoy lleva 6 años en su negocio dedicado a la venta de papelería y útiles escolares. Su jornada de trabajo es de lunes a sábado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m. 
Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía con el fin de mantener un stock y sostener el nivel de ventas.
Su mayor sueño es garantizarles a sus hijos el acceso a la educación superior y que gocen de mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa María, 43, worked for several years in a company in the private sector, but after having three children she had to quit work to take care of them.  This motivated her to open her own business at home so she could help her husband with the household expenses.  Now it has been six years since she started selling stationery goods and school materials.  She works from Monday through Saturday, from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to maintain her stock and sales volume.  Her greatest goal is to guarantee that her children have access to higher education and that they lead a better  lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy stationery goods.

loans.name: Tatiana Divizay

texts.es:
Tatiana de 36 años es madre soltera de dos hijos menores de edad. Razón que la impulsó desde hace más de 15 años,  a convertirse en una gran vendedora de productos de belleza y aseo personal, negocio que le ha permitido solventar los gastos de su hogar y cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hijos. Sus clientes son principalmente las personas de su sector. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una vitrina y surtido para mejorar su nivel de ventas. 
Su mayor sueño es ver crecer su negocio, y poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Espera poder ahorrar para comprar su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Tatiana, 36, is a single mother with two minor children.  This is why over 15 years ago she became a great salesperson of beauty and personal hygiene products.  Her business has allowed her to cover household expenses and her children's basic needs.  Her customers are mainly people involved in the sector.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy a display case and more stock to improve her sales.  Her biggest goal is to expand her business and be able to give her family a better quality of life.  She hopes to save to buy her own house.

loans.use: To buy a display case, and beauty and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Héctor David

texts.es:
Héctor tiene 22 años de edad, esta casado y tiene una hija. Él cultiva hortalizas desde la edad de los 8 años de edad; ya que su padre le enseño desde muy pequeño a trabajar. Ella compra los insumos junto con su mamá para compartir los gastos de transporte, debido a que pagan un vehiculo para trasladar los insumos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar acril y plástico para cerrar el macro túnel y así poder cultivar chile. De esta manera no se atrasara en poder cultivar sus hortalizas y dispondrá de dinero para brindar a su familia salud, educación y alimentación. Su objetivo es comprar un terreno para tener unos 10 macro túneles para cultivar y obtener ingresos para comprar una casa ya que en donde vive es de un tío.
texts.en:
Héctor, 22, is married and has a daughter.  Since he was eight years old he has been growing vegetables, having learned the trade from his father.  He buys supplies together with his mother as they share vehicle transport costs.

The loan he is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy acrylic and plastic to enclose a greenhouse so he can grow chili peppers.  This means he will not have to delay cultivating the vegetables and will have enough money to provide his family with health care, education and food.  His goal is to buy land to set up 10 greenhouses and earn enough money to buy a house.  He now lives with an uncle.

loans.use: To buy acrylic and plastic to enclose a greenhouse to grow chili peppers.

loans.name: Lidia Eleonora

texts.es: DOÑA LIDIA ES ORIGINARIA DE SAN MARTIN JILOTEPEQUE Y MADRE DE DOS NIÑAS, DE LAS CUALES UNA YA ESTA EN LA ESCUELITA Y LA OTRA TIENE APENAS DIES MESES DE NACIDA, ELLA POSEE UN SALON DE BELLEZA Y POR MAS DE 6 AÑOS A MANTENIDO SU NEGOCIO, ELLA AGRADECE A KIVA PORQUE GRACIAS AL CREDITO ANTERIOS PUDO COMPRAR PRODUCTO Y SURTIR MAS SU NEGOCIO, AHORA SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA COMPRAR TINTES PARA EL CABELLO, COSMETICOS DE BELLEZA Y TRATAMIENTOS PARA EL CABELLO. CABE RECALCAR QUE HA SIDO PUNTUAL EN SUS PAGOS, Y ESPERA QUE LA PÚEDAN AYUDAR CON EL CREDITO SOLICITADO.
texts.en: Lidia is from San Martin, Jilotepeque. She is the mother of two girls. One of them is in elementary school and the other is just ten months old. She has had a beauty salon for more than 6 years. She is grateful to Kiva. THanks to the previous loans, she was able to buy product and stock her business. Now she is asking for the loan to buy hair dyes, cosmetics and hair treatments. It is worth mentioning that she she has made her payments on time and she hopes you can help her with the loan she has asked for.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Teresa de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos quienes le ayuan en el negocio, ella se dedica ha elaborar hamacas dese hace vario años, tiene mucha clientela, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Doña teresa solicita un credito que le permita comprar todo lo necesario para la elaboracion: como hilos de diferentes colores, lazos, asi como muestra en la fotografia, entre otras cosas necesarias para seguir con su unica fuente de trabajo y seguirle dando lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en: Teresa is 54 years old. She lives in a home she owns with her two children who help her with her business. She has made hammocks for several years. She has a lot of customers and with her profits she is able to pay for her household expenses. Teresa is asking for a loan to will allow her to buy everything she needs to make the hammocks, such as differently colored threads and ties, as seen in the photograph, as well as other things she needs. This will allow her to continue with her only source of income and keep giving her family what they need.

loans.use: to buy thread to make hammocks.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a 44-year-old married woman who has four children. She describes herself to be independent. 

Miriam operates a charcoal retail store where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a populated area, and she describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to to buy more charcoal to sell. Her business goal is to expand the business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 53, a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Fatuma operates a stall selling grocery vegetables; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding, and establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the loan of KES 40,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell

loans.name: Natalie

texts.es: Natalie, de 34 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Erick y su hija a la que cuida en la casa que se compró hace 8 años.Desde hace 2 años emprendió una empresa de buffet o venta de bebidas y bocaditos, actualmente le va muy bien, confiesa que tiene muchos clientes los que en cada reunión o celebración necesitan sus servicios. “Al día tengo por lo menos un evento, los meses de julio y diciembre se incrementan más, por lo que tengo que contratar personal”, afirma. Es así que trabaja con una anfitriona que realiza un mejor servicio. Ahora ella desea abrir una oficina para poder atraer más cliente y  así crecer en su empresa. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe, así mismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Natalie, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de insumos como café, azúcar y vasos descartables.
texts.en: Natalie is 34 years old. She is an enterprising woman. She lives with her husband, Erick, and their daughter, whom she cares for in the home she bought 8 years ago. Two years ago, she started a catering, or beverage and appetizer business. Now it is going very well for her. She says that she has a lot of customers who need her services at every party or celebration. "Every day, I have at least one event. In the months of July and December, they increase, so I have to hire staff.", she says. That is how she works as a hostess who has the best service. Right now, she wants to open an office to attract more customers and thus grow her business. This is her second Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial help that she receives. She promises to make her payments on time. Natalie will invest the S/.2000 soles in buying materials such as coffee, sugar, and disposable cups.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar and disposable cups.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 39 years old and married to Benson, who contributes to the family income. She has been making local tomato sauce and selling it to food stalls. She has been in the business for about seven years, with an income of approximately KES.30,000  a month.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous loan. She wants to use the loan to buy raw materials to make tomato sauce to sell. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make tomato sauce to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La Sra. Virginia sigue con la misma actividad de llantera. Arreglo de llantas de movilidades  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo para la compra de material de construcción,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para aumentar para la compra de movilidad para hacerle trabajar y recibir una renta diaria y así mejorar sus ingresos, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Virginia continues with her same activity, tire repair for vehicles. She says that the previous loan went well for her, because she used it to buy construction materials. At this time, she is asking for the loan to expand and but a vehicle to work and receive daily rent, improving her income. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity she is being given to grow her business.

loans.use: Aumento para la compra de una movilidad

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 27-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be faithful, trusted, and focused. 

Rehema operates a boutique store selling ladies clothing; she has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a populated area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a stock of clothes to sell. Her business goal is to expand the business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Mwanapazia

texts.en: Mwanapazia is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to boost her retail shop business. With the loan, she plans to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, detergents, and rice. Her dream is to see business expand into a wholesale retail shop and generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, detergents, and rice.

loans.name: Hashim

texts.en: Hashim is 38 years old and married. He has two children and lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is an employee in the government sector getting a low salary, which is barely enough to cover his family's needs. He requested a loan of 300,000 YER to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help him do his homework and reports. This will ensure a better future and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 26 years old and from Nakuru. He is married to Agnes. They have one child who is four years old. Stephen has a mechanic business that he has operated for six years.

He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy a motorbike after paying his previous loan successfully. He hopes to buy a plot in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman. She has five kids who attend school. Her husband is a farmer. Together they own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Riziki has operated a shop kiosk business for the past four years. Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and sugar.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 25-year-old motorcycle transporter; he is married to Martha. They are blessed with one child. He has been ferrying people using his motorcycle for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,500 which he uses to support his family. 

Patrick is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to repair the motorbike and buy enough fuel for the motorbike. 


With the expected profit from the business, he will open a retail shop for his wife. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and that of his wife.

loans.use: to repair his motorbike and buy enough fuel for the motorbike.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a returning Kiva client. This time she is requesting a loan of Kshs 30,000 for her food stall business. With the loan, she wants to boost her kiosk, purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 43-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 7 years to 18 years. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a retail store where he sells bags, caps, belts, scuffs and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are middle and low income earners. 

John describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to to buy stock of caps, scuffs, belts, bags and other items for resale. His business goal is to expand the business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy stock of caps, scuffs, belts, bags and other items for resale

loans.name: Mgandi

texts.en:
Mgandi is a married man and has been blessed with seven children. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past five years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. He cites the high cost of transportation as his major challenge. 

Mgandi is requesting Kshs 50,000 to boost his kiosk, purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking oil. He dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. Mary owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mary operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman and has been blessed with six children all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past fifteen years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites high cost of transportation as her major challenge. 

Mwanamisi is requesting a loan of Kshs 10,000 to pay school fees for her grandchild who is under her care. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her grandchild who is under her care.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a single man who owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, he has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil. He cites theft and competition as his major challenges. 

Juma is requesting Kshs 20,000 to boost his kiosk, purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat oil. He dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to boost his kiosk, purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Mwamtsesi

texts.en:
Mwamtsesi is married to a businesswoman and they own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Their greatest monthly expense is food. 

Mwamtsesi has operated a fresh water selling business for the past 2 years, selling from home to his neighbors. He faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business. 

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase a hand cart to aid in supplying water to his customers' homes. He dreams of expanding his business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a hand cart to aid in supplying water to his customers' homes.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 42-year-old man and he is married and has 4 children who all go to school. He wants this loan he has asked for to purchase more stock for his shop. Most of his customers are people from the neighborhood. Because of the variety of things he has, a number of young people frequent his shop.

He started this shop four years ago and still supplements his income with agriculture. He hopes that his shop will keep expanding so that he can pay for his children's fees until they complete school.

Shown in the photograph is the customer and his wife who also helps him to sell.

loans.use: To buy different commodities for the shop.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has owned a restaurant business, where neighbors and town dwellers are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge with delayed payments by those who buy on credit.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama is a married woman. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in an area with many customers, and her primary customers are local residents. She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to add a stock of flour, cooking oil and other ingredients used in cooking food to sell.

loans.use: to add a stock of flour, cooking oil and other ingredients.

loans.name: Zaverio

texts.en:
Zaverio used the previous loan to buy school uniforms and other clothes to sell. He is a 59-year-old married man with 8 children, living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a dream of educating his children up to higher levels.

He owns a tailoring shop and he specifically deals in school uniforms. He has been in business for 15 years and the major challenge faced now is price fluctuations that result in high operational costs. 

His dream is to acquire a contract of supplying school uniforms to about 50 schools, and so far he supplies ten schools. Zaverio intends to use the loan to buy school uniforms and other clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as honest. 

She operates a retail store where she sells sugar, flour, salt, cooking oil and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with many customers and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as harassment by law enforcers. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of sugar, flour, salt, cooking oil and other items. Her business goal is to have a big business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, flour, salt, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Mdzara

texts.en:
Mdzara is coming for another Kiva loan of KES 15,000 to boost her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase cooking fat, wheat flour, maize flour, and rice. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. Her dream is to establish a modern cafe in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat, wheat flour, maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en: Mlongo is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is for food for the family. For the past four years, she has been in business cooking mahamri (dumplings) and selling them from home to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding to the café business. With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to buy bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and charcoal to cook dumplings to sell.

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
Mose is a married woman who has seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

For the past one year, she has operated an open air food business, frying potatoes for sale to her neighbors and students from a neighboring school. In addition she also does a coral reefs business that earns her another source of livelihood. 

She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy season when it becomes difficult to operate. She dreams of establishing a café.

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to add stock of potatoes, cooking oil, and charcoal for cooking. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to add stock of potatoes, cooking oil, and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Rachael is married to Said and they have three children, all of whom attend school. Rachael owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, Rachael has operated a business selling coconuts at retail to local neighbors. The major business challenge she faces is the high cost of transportation. Rachael dreams of expanding her existing business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 10,000, Rachael wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a single woman who has five children, two of whom attend school while three are still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mupa operates a food selling business, making dumplings, flat bread, and beans for sale. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also does farming, which earns her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and beans.

loans.name: Mapenzi

texts.en: Mapenzi is a married mother of four children, all whom attend school. She lives at her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is for school fees. For the past three years, she has operated a business selling firewood to her neighbors and to passersby at the market. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transporting stock from rural areas to her place of business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a large firewood store in the future. With the loan that she is applying for, of KES 20,000, she wants to buy bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is married to Stephen, and they are blessed with two children, all of whom attend school. They live in their own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is for school fees. Cecilia has owned a kindergarten school for over two years, with kids from the neighborhood attending classes. She cites delayed payments of school fees by parents as her major challenge. With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to repair broken chairs and tables and also buy teaching aids. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business..

loans.use: to repair broken chairs and tables and to buy teaching aids, for her kindergarten school.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a single mother of three children, all of whom attend school and are the reason for her hard work. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to clear their credit balances.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en: Dzame is taking out another Kiva loan, of KES 30,000, to boost her food selling business. With the loan, she wants to buy bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil and to buy a Jiko (charcoal burner). She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is grateful for the opportunity that Kiva lenders and Yehu have given her.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil and to buy a Jiko (charcoal burner) for her business.

loans.name: Diwa

texts.en:
Diwa is a married man and has been blessed with eight children, four of whom attend school. Together with his wife, who is a farmer, they own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For one year, Diwa has operated a goat meat selling business, buying and fattening goats to sell from home at a profit to slaughter operators. He dreams of expanding his business to accommodate the whole town in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase goats for fattening and later resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for fattening and later resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock of cooking oil and potatoes.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman blessed with six children who all attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Over eight years, she has operated a dry fish selling business, selling at the market to town dwellers and passersby. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a retail shop in the near future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to build a shed for selling fish and purchase bundles of fish for resale. She joined Yehu because of favorable loaning policies.

loans.use: to build a shed for selling fish and to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, corrugated metal roofing and wood.

loans.name: David Miguel

texts.es:
El señor David miguel vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja en una universidad de Managua en  el área de  mantenimiento.

El señor David está solicitando un crédito a kiva  para gastos médicos de una operación de su hermana y compra de medicina.

A la vez manifiesta que gracias a los créditos otorgados en ceprodel ha podido mejorar su vivienda poco a poco  para darle una vivienda digna a su familia.
texts.en:
David Miguel lives in the city of Managua. He works at a university in Managua in the maintenance department. 

David is requesting a loan from Kiva for medical expenses due to an operation for his sister and as well as for purchasing medication. 

At the same time, the loans given to him by Ceprodel,   have allowed him to improve his house, little by little, in order to give his family a decent home.

loans.use: with medical expenses.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Don Juan vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos el se dedica a la pesca desde hace varios años  con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar cubrir los gastos de su hogar, Don Juan solicita un credito para poder comprar unas atarrayas que son las que le sirven para la pesca asi como la que muestra en la fotografia ya sin eso el no podria salir a pescar y esa es us una fuente de trabajo y asi el podra seguir llevando el pan de cada dia ha su hogar.
texts.en: Juan lives in his own home with his wife and three children. He has worked as a fisherman for several years. With the income he earns from his sales, he is able to pay household expenses. Juan is requesting a loan to buy nets, as shown in the photo. He will use these nets for fishing, and without them he wouldn't be able to fish, which is his source of work. With the nets, he will be able to continue providing for his family.

loans.use: to buy nets for fishing

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu is married to Hamisi, and they have six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is for food for the family. For the past ten years, she has operated a coconut-selling business, selling wholesale to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. Saumu dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future. With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to buy sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a single woman who has not been blessed with children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, Salama has operated a vegetable kiosk business, selling green vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes. She sells primarily to her local neighbors. Additionally, she sells fresh water, which enables her to earn another source of income. Salama dreams of expanding and establishing a shop in the future.

With the KES 15,000, Salama wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Preccids

texts.en:
Preccids is a 40-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 4 years to 20 years. She describes herself as trustworthy and friendly. 

She operates a food stall where she sells porridge. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an area with many customers and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of sugar, flour and other items and also to start another business that is not labor-intensive. Her business goal is to have a big business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful in life. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, flour and other items and also to start another business that is not labor-intensive.

loans.name: Zabibu

texts.en:
Zabibu is married to Chilodi who is a businessman. They have five children, all of whom attend school. Zabibu owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, Zabibu has operated a business selling fresh water to her local neighbors. The major business challenge she faces is seasonality. Zabibu dreams of establishing a new grocery store business in the future.

With the KES 30,000, Zabibu wants to pay to establish another water point and purchase a water tap to supply more water. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay to establish another water point and to purchase a water tap to supply more water.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a widow and has been blessed with seven children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past the three years, she has operated a vegetable kiosk business, selling green vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes. She sells primarily to local neighbors. Bahati dreams of expanding and establishing a grocery shop in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of cabbages, onions, potatoes and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cabbages, onions, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Dio

texts.en:
Dio is a 36-year-old man. He has five children. He describes himself as honest. 

He operates a food stall where he sells fried cassava. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an area with many customers and his primary customers are students. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of a good operating area. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of cassava. His business goal is to have a big business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be self-reliant. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of cassava.

loans.name: Wemona

texts.en:
Wemona is married and has six children, two of whom still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her children.

For the past two years, Wemona has operated a business selling fruits and vegetables to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenges are the high cost of transportation and stiff competition from the other vegetable vendors. 

With the KES 10,000, Wemona wants to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a recurring Kiva client. She is applying for a loan of KES 50,000 to boost her food market business. With the loan, she plans to purchase maize flour, beans and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. Harriet dreams of expanding to a wholesale market shop business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Even though Ekua grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells "kenkey" (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves) and fish for a living. She primarily sells her "kenkey" and fish in Ay/New Town (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began two years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their two children. 

Ekua has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her "kenkey" and fish. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize and fish, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty "kenkey" and fish. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize and fish, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty "kenkey" and fish.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Agnes is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling saabo (maize and groundnuts cooked together) in Ay/New Town (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years. Agnes is married and has two children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Agnes will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize and groundnuts, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize and groundnuts.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is single and has four children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ekua is a successful businesswoman. She sells second-hand clothing in Ay/New Town (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 10 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ekua uses her income to provide for the entire family.

 Ekua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of second-hand clothing, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Regina is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling sandals in Ay/New Town (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. Regina is married and has four children. Her husband works as a pastor. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband to cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Regina wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of sandals. In the long term, Regina plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling doughnuts in Onyaadze (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. 

Ekua is married and has two children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Ekua wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels of flour, sugar, and cooking oil, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of doughnuts. In the long term, Ekua plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of flour, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
After graduating Junior High School, Kwame decided to set up his own fried fish business in Onyaadze (near Cape Coast). With over three years' worth of experience, he is currently looking to expand his enterprise further. Unfortunately, he is limited due to a lack of funding. 

As a result, this loan will be used to help him purchase more fish for resale. He aims at using the profits from his business to help support his wife (who is in trading) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their child is able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help him purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, who appears in the photo, is a 20-year-old single man. Mohammad lives with his family in Gaza and his father owns a sewing workshop, which is a profitable project and the only source of income for the family.

Mohammad is a university student who wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Mohammad to do his homework and reports and help him in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Mohammad and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a new laptop

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed, who appears in the photo, is a 42-year-old married man and a father to four sons and two daughters. Majed is employed and earns a small salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

Majed is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new bedroom furniture in order to improve living conditions in his house. Taking out this loan will offer Majed and his family comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. 

In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase new bedroom furniture

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 32 years old and married with three children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a fishing business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over five years and earns 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fishing materials such as nets and hooks. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as nets and hooks.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 43-year-old married man, a father to four sons and two daughters.

Mohammad lives in Jenin city with his family in modest living conditions. For the past three years, Mohammad has had a cafe. He has many loyal customers and the cafe is located in a good area, which makes his project a profitable one. It  is the only source of income for the family, but also needs more support to cover some necessary costs.

Mohammad is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of improving his cafe and purchasing new equipment such as coffee and tea cups, trays and an electric water heater.

This will allow Mohammad to expand the scope of his work, improve his business, and increase the family's income. Mohammad is photographed in his cafe.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for his cafe

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves). She usually sells her kenkey in Ay/New Town (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling kenkey for six years. Efua is married and has five children. Her husband works as a miller. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Efua wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty kenkey. In the long term, Efua plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the rising customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 53 years old, married and lives in the Philippines with her husband and one child. For the past five years, she has earned a living by providing transportation services to people who live in her community. She earns about 35,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month and is applying for a loan for 45,000 PHP to repair the vehicle that she uses to transport her passengers. 

Last year, Adelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and life. In the future, she hopes to provide a better standard of living to her family.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle used in her transportation business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 50 years old and married with three children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She has joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Don Manuel es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz y frijol cuando su cosecha esta lista la va almacenando en lo graneros que muestra en la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarlos a los mercados de granos basicos que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia. Don Manuel desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Manuel is a very responsible man who keeps up with his household obligations, as he has always been characterized for bringing the best to his family. He lives with his wife and children and is very hard working. He has always worked with happiness and enthusiasm. He makes a living as a farmer planting corn and beans. When his harvest is ready he stores his crops in the granaries that are shown in the photo to then go out to sell them in the basic grain market near his home. 

Manuel hopes to increase his sales and for this reason he is requesting a loan which would allow him to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides and other supplies. He hopes to count on the help requested because of the fact that he does not have other sources of income. In this way, he will continue being able to put food on the table each day without any setbacks.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies including seeds, manure and fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Terguunbayar

texts.en: Terguunbayar, 35, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (a portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. Just one year ago, she began providing taxi services to local people using her own automobile on work days. On the weekends, she and her husband make and sell jackets to vendors in various districts at wholesale prices. Last year they began building a house on their land because the Mongolian winter is very harsh, forcing them to burn lot of coal to heat the ger so they don't freeze. But due to lack of finances, they haven't finished their house completely and some necessary items are remaining. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase vacuum insulated windows, metal shakes used for roofing and cement. As you can see from the picture, her house needs roofing and windows. After using these materials, she and her husband can complete their house and provide warm and comfortable accommodation for their children. More importantly, this new high quality house won't lose its heat and will enable the family to reduce its coal consumption, thus contributing to efforts against air pollution by releasing less smoke to air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who greatly cares for her children.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum insulated windows, metal shakes and cement.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.en: Otilia is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to improve her business. She is now 30 years old and has 4 children. She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, cooking oil and cigarettes. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2011. She feels so comfortable about running her business because she can earn money every day.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, cooking oil and cigarettes.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.en: Maxima, 59, is married with five children. She has one motorcycle. Her husband Restillo is the one who manages it. To help her husband in financing the maintenance of the motorcycle. Maxima is asking a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy spare parts. In the future, Maxima dreams that she can improve the quality of living for her family some day.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Saman

texts.en:
A farmer from Kror Kor district of Pursat province, SamAn is 59 years old and blessed with five children. Currently, only one daughter is staying with her and helping with the family’s business and household chores. From the current business, SamAn is able to earn about 7,000 KHR per day. Including this cycle, she is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loans completely and she wisely manages her loans to support her business in a timely manner. 

Now, she is seeking 1,000,000 KHR in order to pay the house-builder who has built her house. She hopes to own a decent house for her family.

loans.use: To pay for house construction expenses

loans.name: Ky's Group

texts.en:
Ky is 49 years old and a citizen of Kror Kor district of Pursat province. She has two children; one is a disabled person and another one is working as a paid worker at the rice mill. She overcomes her family’s hardship as a single mother via rice farming on one hectare of land. She has been engaged in the current business for ages and is able to earn up to 12,900 KHR per day. 

This is the fifth loan for Ky’s group composed of three members. She has wisely utilized her past loans which she has repaid to better support her business in a good pace. Now, the total of her group loan is 1,600,000 KHR, of which 400,000 KHR is her loan portion. She will use her loan portion to buy columns for house construction. She hopes own a decent new house for her family, especially for her kids.

loans.use: To buy columns for house construction

loans.name: Yeang's Group

texts.en:
Yeang, 38 and married, is an inhabitant of Kampong Cham province. She has three children to care for, as they are still in school. She manages a five-hectare area for growing cassava.

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is a second-time borrower, whose first loan has been repaid completely. The previous loan enabled her to grow her cash crop on time and provided her a decent income. Now, she is in a group of six to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to lease additional farmland, to plow her farmland, and to buy potash. She hopes that she can replant her crops seasonably and better her lifestyle.

loans.use: To lease an additional parcel of farmland, to plow her farmland, and to buy potash

loans.name: Chen's Group

texts.en:
Chen, a local farmer from Batambang province, is 26 years old and a mother of two children. She earns a living through farming rice on three hectares as the only source of the family's income. This is the business that she has had for six years, earning about 22,700 KHR per day. Chen has been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for the past five cycles and has fully repaid back her past loans with success. It has enabled her to upgrade her living status to a good condition. 

Now, she leads a group of three to apply for a new loan from VisionFund. She and one of her co-borrowers are seeking for 1,400,000 KHR each while the remaining member is requesting 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash, rice seed, and to pay for the plowing and reaping fees. She hopes that she can gain a high yield from her crops and make a good profit for her children's sake.

loans.use: To buy potash, rice seed, and to pay for the plowing and reaping fees

loans.name: Primo

texts.en:
Primo is 39 years old, married, with two children. He lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, he owns and operates a crab-vending business. He has been in his business for over five years and earns PHP 10,000 every month. 

Primo joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2010 and now he has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional crabs to sell. In the future, he wants to make improvements to his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs to sell.

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run, 57, lives with his wife and three children in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. He and his wife have struggled to feed their family by farming rice and growing cassava on an almost three-hectare farmland in which they have been in the business for twenty-seven years. Together, they can earn about $13 USD per day and manage to save about $5 USD each day for the future. 

Run has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped him better support his family with enough food. Now he is applying for a loan with VisionFund. With this loan, he is going to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees in plowing the field. He hopes to grow his rice and cassava healthily to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Touqeer

texts.en: Touqeer is widow who lives in an area of Lahore. Her husband was a daily wager and soon after his death, Touqeer started a sewing business to provide her children with the basic necessities of life.  She decided to face the grimness of life courageously. She is very familiar with stitching techniques and enjoys a great client list. By now, Touqeer has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. To meet the orders on time, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors, as well as packs of needles and buttons. With these, she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.
